0.title: Russian air activity remains high over Ukraine's Donbas: UK
0.article_body: The UK's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that Russia's air activity remains high over Ukraine's Donbas region with Russian aircraft carrying out strikes using both guided and unguided munitions. "The increased use of unguided munitions has led to the widespread destruction of built-up areas...and has almost certainly caused substantial collateral damage and civilian casualties," it added.

1.title: Does everyone think rape is a joke: Richa on Layer'r Shot's ads
1.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha has reacted to the Layer'r Shot ads accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. She tweeted, "This ad is not an accident...DOES EVERYONE THINK RAPE IS A JOKE? Revelatory! This brand, the agency that made this ad need to be sued for the filth they're serving." DCW chief Swati Maliwal said it "blatantly promotes rape mentality".

2.title: Saw a few games of Nadal-Djokovic: Sharapova on watching French Open 2022
2.article_body: During a Q&A session on Instagram, five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova was asked if she was watching the 2022 French Open, to which she replied, "I watched a few games of Rafael Nadal-Novak Djokovic." She added, "[I] don't have cable so caught it on Tennis Channel's feed." Nadal defeated Djokovic 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in the quarter-final.

3.title: World number one Swiatek defeats 18-year-old Gauff to win her second French Open title
3.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in the 2022 Roland Garros women's singles final to win her second French Open title. The 21-year-old Polish tennis player won the match with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3. With the win, Swiatek also extended her winning streak to 35 matches. Swiatek had won her maiden French Open title in 2020.

4.title: I spend ₹25 lakh every month to feed 5,000 people: Gambhir on why he works in IPL
4.article_body: Talking about why he works in IPL, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said, "It is because I spend ₹25 lakh every month to feed 5,000 people." He added, "I spend all of this money from my own pocket and not from the MPLADS fund. The MPLADS fund doesn’t run my kitchen or other things that I do."

5.title: UK Police briefly evacuates Trafalgar Square over suspicious car
5.article_body: The police in the UK on Saturday briefly evacuated London's Trafalgar Square over a suspicious car at the tourist hotspot. The police said that they had carried out a controlled explosion while investigating the vehicle. "This was investigated and after police took action we have no further concern. This was not terrorism-related," they added.

6.title: Video shows UP woman being thrashed by in-laws for not giving birth to son
6.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a woman being allegedly thrashed publicly by her in-laws for not giving birth to a boy in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba district. As per reports, the woman had given birth to two daughters after her marriage, but her in-laws were demanding a boy. Police have booked five persons, including the victim's husband and father-in-law.

7.title: I'm getting threats to my life: Bengali singer as he apologises for 'Who is KK?' remark
7.article_body: Bengali singer Rupankar Bagchi has apologised to late singer KK's family and fans. This comes days after Rupankar was criticised for questioning the frenzy around KK, a day before his death. "I'm getting physical threats and...threats to my life," he stated. Rupankar, in a Facebook live session, had said, "Who's KK?" while adding that West Bengal has better singers.

8.title: Any type of competitive cricket will be good for SA before T20 WC: Bavuma
8.article_body: Ahead of South Africa tour of India for five T20Is, South Africa limited-overs skipper Temba Bavuma said that any type of competitive cricket is good for the team before the T20 World Cup in Australia in October. "The conditions in India don't accurately simulate conditions in Australia. In saying that, there's still a lot of benefit from playing," he added.

9.title: K'taka CM dissolves textbook revision panel, says 'open to changes'
9.article_body: Karnataka CM BS Bommai has dissolved the controversial textbook revision committee and said that the government was open to re-revising the content of the textbooks if people had objections to changes introduced by the panel. Bommai's decision came after the state Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh submitted a report on the committee.

10.title: 'Fat finger' trade causes ₹250 crore loss in India's biggest trading mistake: Report
10.article_body: A 'fat finger' trade on the National Stock Exchange's (NSE) derivatives segment on Thursday may have caused a loss of up to ₹250 crore to an unknown brokerage house, PTI reported. This could be the biggest trading mistake in the history of the Indian market. A 'fat finger' error is a human error caused by pressing the wrong key.

11.title: 77-yr-old Mumbai man tries to get ₹1,100 refund, loses ₹8 lakh
11.article_body: A 77-year-old Mumbai resident lost ₹8 lakh of his life savings while trying to get a refund of ₹1,100. Police said the victim booked a fleet cab on May 27, which cost ₹550, but the amount was deducted thrice from e-wallet. He called the cab's customer care number, after which a person posing as an 'executive' defrauded him, police added.

12.title: Indian banned for 'faking' Everest climb in 2016 scales peak, says 'had to prove myself'
12.article_body: An Indian climber, who was banned for six years from climbing the world's highest peak in 2016, has scaled the peak. Narender Yadav claimed to have scaled Mount Everest in 2016 but his pictures were found to be digitally altered after which the Nepal government imposed the ban. "I (had to) prove myself and climb Everest," said Yadav.

13.title: Karthik can be in India's T20 WC squad if he plays Dhoni's role: Shastri
13.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik can be a part of Indian team if he plays a Dhoni-type role in 2022 T20 World Cup. He added that one has to see from the team's point of view, what are they looking for. Karthik has been included in India's squad for upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa.

14.title: Incredibly tasteless & twisted minds: Farhan on Layer'r Shot's ads
14.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar reacted to the ads of body spray Layer'r Shot which have been accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. He tweeted, "What incredibly tasteless and twisted minds it must take to think up, approve and create these stinking body spray 'gang rape' innuendo ads..!! Shameful." The Information and Broadcasting Ministry has ordered suspension of the ads.

15.title: Man jailed for 7 days for touching women inappropriately in Hyd
15.article_body: The Special Metropolitan Magistrate Court of Hyderabad sentenced a 20-year-old man, Asmaul SK, to seven days imprisonment for "touching women inappropriately" in a crowded place. Hyderabad Police said that the man was caught red-handed by She Teams in Charminar area of the city. Members of She Teams recorded the act and immediately arrested Asmaul in the case.

16.title: Not disappointed: Shahid on Jersey's box office performance
16.article_body: On being asked about the box office performance of his film 'Jersey', actor Shahid Kapoor said he is not disappointed, adding that it will always be close to his heart. The actor added, "It's been two years since COVID-19 and we need to understand how the audience feels." He further said that it is time for everyone to learn.

17.title: All Odisha ministers resign ahead of Cabinet reshuffle
17.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday asked all Cabinet ministers to resign ahead of a reshuffle on June 5. The new Council of Ministers will reportedly take oath on Sunday. The reshuffle exercise began a day after the ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) won three Rajya Sabha seats unopposed and the bypoll in the Brajrajnagar Assembly constituency.

18.title: Mumbai man gets death penalty for 8-year-old girl's rape & murder
18.article_body: A special Mumbai court awarded the death penalty to Vadivel alias Gundappa Devendra, for the rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in 2019. He committed the crime within a year of being released from jail after he was convicted of sexually assaulting another minor in 2013. Judge HC Shende said the repeat offence showed that Vadivel's reformation is impossible.

19.title: 1 in every 36 infants in India dies within 1 yr of its life: Data
19.article_body: One in every 36 infants in India dies within the first year of its life, according to official data. In 2020, the highest infant mortality rate was reported in Madhya Pradesh at 43 and the lowest IMR was reported in Mizoram at 3. However, there has been a declining trend in IMR over the past few decades, the data showed.

20.title: Rachakonda Police bust fake land registration racket, 7 arrested
20.article_body: The Special Operations Team along with Adibatla Police busted a fake land registration racket and arrested seven persons, Rachakonda Police said. A sale deed, two cars and mobile phones, all worth ₹1,02,30,000, were seized from the accused. The accused were arrested on charges of creating a forged sale deed and making efforts to take possession of vacant land.

21.title: They've propped us up: 'Ms Marvel' actor on Farhan, Fawad's cameos
21.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' actor Mohan Kapur has spoken about Farhan Akhtar and Fawad Khan's cameos in the show, saying that they propped up the show. "Just...hearing their names, the audience goes to buy tickets. They've earned that," he added. Mohan further said, "It's very small if you start thinking, 'I am in more episodes so why are they talking about them'."

22.title: Working with Vicky Kaushal was amazing, he's so talented: Sara
22.article_body: Sara Ali Khan has called working with Vicky Kaushal amazing, adding he is a talented guy. "He's so easy-going...working with him is a lot of fun," she added. The two will be seen together in Laxman Utekar's untitled film. On being asked about her dream role, Sara said she wants to play a queen in a Sanjay Leela Bhansali film.

23.title: Gill is the most difficult batter to bowl to in the nets: GT's Dayal
23.article_body: When asked about the batter he found most difficult to bowl to in the nets in IPL 2022, GT pacer Yash Dayal replied teammate "Shubman Gill". He added, "He's not late at all on any delivery. He plays cricketing shots, you have seen what a classical batter he is." Gill was GT's second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022 with 483 runs.

24.title: Jasmin to make Bollywood debut with film penned by Mahesh Bhatt: Report
24.article_body: Television actress and former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Jasmin Bhasin will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with a film penned by Mahesh Bhatt. According to reports, the actress will start shooting for the film at the end of July this year. The film will be directed by Manish Chavan, who will be making his directorial debut with this venture, reports added.

25.title: Sarah Silverman joins cast of Bradley Cooper's film 'Maestro'
25.article_body: Actress Sarah Silverman has joined the cast of Netflix's upcoming film 'Maestro'. Based on American music composer-conductor Leonard Bernstein, the film is directed by Bradley Cooper who will be seen playing the lead role. According to Deadline, Silverman will play Bernstein's sister in the film. Besides her, the film also features Carey Mulligan, Matt Bomer and Maya Hawke.

26.title: I've retired, haven't played after losing my dad who was my no. 1 fan: Tevez
26.article_body: Ex-Manchester United forward Carlos Tevez has announced his retirement from football, adding he stopped playing because he lost his adopted father Segundo Tevez due to COVID-19 complications in February 2021. Tevez stated Segundo was his number one fan. "I used to get up at 6 am to go training...I don't have the strength to do that," he had earlier said.

27.title: 6 killed, 20 hurt as boiler explodes at chemical factory in UP's Hapur
27.article_body: At least six workers died and 20 others were injured after a boiler exploded at a chemical factory on Saturday in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. Police and fire-tenders have rushed to the spot and rescue operations are underway. CM Yogi Adityanath has expressed grief over deaths and has directed the district administration to extend all possible help to the deceased's families.

28.title: Shakira, Gerard Piqué separate after 12 years of relationship amid cheating rumours
28.article_body: Singer Shakira and footballer Gerard Piqué said on Saturday that they are separating after 12 years of relationship. "We regret to confirm that we are separating. For the well-being of our children, who are our highest priority, we request respect for (our) privacy," they said in a statement. This comes amid reports that Shakira caught Piqué cheating on her.

29.title: Kartik Aaryan tests positive for COVID-19 for 2nd time
29.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to social media on Saturday to inform that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "Sab kuch itna positive chal raha tha, Covid se raha nahi gaya (Everything was going so well, Covid couldn't bear to be left out)," the actor wrote. Notably, this is the second time that Kartik has tested positive for the virus.

30.title: Illegal properties of Kanpur violence accused to be demolished: UP Police
30.article_body: The illegal properties of the accused allegedly involved in the violence that broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday will be demolished, UP Police Additional Director General (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said on Saturday. "The situation has been brought under control. Identification of the accused is being done," he said. "Action will be taken against them," Kumar added.

31.title: Masks not mandatory, there's no fine but I request public to wear them: Maha minister
31.article_body: After a Maharashtra government official said masks were mandatory in closed spaces, the state's Health Minister Rajesh Tope refuted it, saying there's no fine for not wearing masks. However, he appealed to the public in the state to wear masks in spaces like buses, schools, trains and offices. This came amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra.

32.title: 2 UN peacekeepers killed by bomb blast in Mali
32.article_body: Two United Nations peacekeepers were killed and two others were injured after their vehicle was hit by an improvised explosive device in Mali on Friday, according to UN Spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric. It's the second fatal attack this week on a peacekeeping convoy in the West African country, an official statement said. A peacekeeper was killed in an attack on Wednesday.

33.title: 4 former Punjab Congress ministers join BJP in Amit Shah's presence
33.article_body: Former Punjab Congress ministers Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh on Saturday in Home Minister Amit Shah's presence. Former Congress leader KS Dhillon and former SAD MLA SC Singla are also reportedly set to join BJP. State Congress chief ASR Warring called the switchovers "a blessing in disguise".

34.title: Corbevax approved as COVID-19 booster shot for those aged 18 yrs & above
34.article_body: Biological E on Saturday announced its COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax has been approved by Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) for administering booster doses to people aged 18 years and above. Corbevax was earlier approved for emergency use in kids aged 5-12 years and 12-15 years. Adults fully vaccinated with two doses of Covishield or Covaxin can take a Corbevax booster.

35.title: Don't believe social media rumours, I'm not interested in elections: Moosewala's father
35.article_body: Late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, in a video shared on Instagram, urged people to not believe in social media rumours. "I am not interested in any election," he stated. He further invited people to Moosewala's Bhog on June 8 and thanked them for their support. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

36.title: US-based email startup Superhuman fires 22% staff amid downturn
36.article_body: California-based email startup Superhuman has fired 23 employees, which made up about 22% of its workforce. CEO Rahul Vohra made the announcement on Twitter while attributing the layoffs to a "downturn that could last years". He added that the 23 employees will be provided with a generous severance package, support throughout the year and assistance in looking for new jobs.

37.title: PM Modi stopped Russia-Ukraine war for 3 hrs to evacuate Indians: BJP leader
37.article_body: Senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Friday claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi stopped the Russia-Ukraine war for three hours to evacuate Indian students stranded in Ukraine. "PM spoke to Russian President...his Ukrainian counterpart...to stop the war so that the Indian...students could be evacuated," Prasad claimed. "The PM [said]...he would not leave his children in a war zone," he added.

38.title: Woman's body found half-buried, crushed with stone in Jharkhand
38.article_body: A woman's body was found half-buried and crushed to death with a stone in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. The body was found to have been hurriedly buried by the assailants and wrapped in a shroud, police said. Notably, the deceased's age is believed to be in the mid-30s, police added. Meanwhile, the body has been sent to hospital for post-mortem.

39.title: Driver killed, 8 people injured as high-speed train derails in China
39.article_body: A high-speed train derailed in southwestern China on Saturday, killing the driver and injuring at least eight people, state broadcaster CCTV reported. All other 136 passengers were safe. The train was running from Guiyang to Guangzhou province when the two coaches derailed at a tunnel entrance after it ploughed into debris deposited on the tracks by a mudslide, CCTV said.

40.title: Hardik should play only T20Is till T20 WC, playing ODIs a risk: Shastri
40.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said all-rounder Hardik Pandya should only play T20Is till the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, adding it will be a "risk" if Hardik is asked to play ODIs. Shastri stated Hardik's availability across departments makes a massive difference and changes the whole balance in India's favour. "He does the job for two players," said Shastri.

41.title: B'luru man strangles mother to death with saree for not buying him phone
41.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly strangling his mother to death with her saree. The accused, identified as Deepak, went to help his mother who used to pluck and sell leafy vegetables. He later called his father and said she was found dead. After inquiry, police discovered that Deepak killed his mother for not buying him a phone.

42.title: I'm really looking forward to 'No Entry 2', the script is hilarious: Fardeen
42.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has said that he's very excited about 'No Entry 2', a sequel to his 2005 film. "I'm really, really looking forward to that...I've heard the story and the script and let me tell you it's hilarious. It's got to be double, triple the fun," he added. Anil Kapoor and Salman Khan will also return for the sequel.

43.title: Action against those responsible for Visakhapatnam gas leak: Chandrababu Naidu
43.article_body: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that "action should be taken" against those responsible for the recent gas leak incident in a Visakhapatnam-based laboratory in which around 200 workers fell ill. "The failure of the government departments and absence of monitoring has become a curse for the public," Naidu said.

44.title: No way Google CEO doesn't know about caste: Dalit activist whose talk was cancelled
44.article_body: Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan, whose talk on caste bias was cancelled by Google after some employees' protest, said there's no way that Google CEO Sundar Pichai doesn't know about caste. "[Pichai] is Indian and he is Brahmin and he grew up in Tamil Nadu," she told the Washington Post, adding that Pichai must make a statement regarding this controversy.

45.title: Only Indian money funds war? EAM on criticism over India buying Russian oil
45.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar rejected criticism from the West that India's purchase of Russian oil is helping fund the Ukraine war. Jaishankar said, "If India buying Russian oil is funding the war...Tell me...buying Russian gas isn't funding the war? It's only Indian money and Russian oil coming to India funding the war and not Russia's gas coming to Europe not funding?"

46.title: 'Anupamaa' gave me popularity that Robot 2.0 could not: Sudhanshu
46.article_body: Sudhanshu Pandey, who plays the role of Vanraj Shah in 'Anupamaa', has said he had never imagined that the show would become "such a huge hit". "I've done...Hollywood film and...Robot 2.0. I've worked with Jackie Chan, Rajnikanth, Akshay Kumar...But the popularity I got from 'Anupamaa', I've not experienced anything like this before even after doing these big-budget films," he said.

47.title: Duo jailed, fined ₹1 lakh each in hash oil case: Bengaluru police
47.article_body: Bengaluru DCP (South East Division) Joshi Srinath Mahadev on Saturday said that two people, Johnson and Biju, have been sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment in a hash oil case. The accused have also been fined ₹1 lakh each in the case. "Congrats SG Palya police...Our commitment against drug offences is unquestionable," the DCP added.

48.title: Wasn't sure I'll be picked after first 2 IPL 2022 games: CSK's Mukesh
48.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary said he was "confused" about what he was doing wrong after his first two IPL 2022 matches for CSK, adding he wasn't sure if he would be picked for the remaining matches. "[However] the...management backed me," added Mukesh. Mukesh picked 16 wickets in 13 IPL 2022 matches and had a bowling strike rate of 17.

49.title: Will talk to Bajaj to start ethanol-run scooter-auto in Pune: Gadkari
49.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has requested Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar to come together to call a meeting with Bajaj Auto, saying, "We'll speak to Bajaj to start scooter-auto in Pune on 100% ethanol." "I went behind [PM Narendra Modi]...got three Indian Oil ethanol pumps in Pune but not a single drop of it (is) sold yet," he added.

50.title: Monkeypox suspected in 5-year-old girl in UP, samples sent for testing
50.article_body: A 5-year-old girl in UP's Ghaziabad is suspected to have been infected with the monkeypox virus, the UP government has said, adding that her samples have been sent to ICMR-NIV, Pune for testing. The girl complained of itching and rashes, the state government said. Neither she nor any of her close relatives travelled abroad in the past month, it added.

51.title: Nepal Women dismissed for 8 runs vs UAE in U19 T20 WC qualifier, 6 players record ducks
51.article_body: Nepal Women were bowled out for 8 runs in 8.1 overs against UAE in an ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier 2022 match. Six Nepal players recorded ducks, while Sneha Mahara top-scored with three runs off 10 balls. UAE chased down the target in 1.1 overs. UAE's Mahika Gaur recorded figures of 4-2-2-5.

52.title: Sec 144 imposed in Karnataka's Mandya after VHP calls for rally
52.article_body: Section 144 CrPC has been imposed in the Srirangapatna town in Karnataka's Mandya after the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) called for a 'Srirangapatna Chalo' march on Saturday. The restrictions will be in place from 6 am to 6 pm. Over 500 police personnel have been deployed and CCTV cameras and four check posts have been installed to secure the area.

53.title: Will install 500 Tricolours in Delhi by August 15: CM Kejriwal
53.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said the AAP government will install 500 Tricolours in the national capital by August 15. "A five-member committee will be formed for each flag to ensure the Flag Code of India," he added. Kejriwal said the committees should gather people at the flags' location at 10 am every Sunday to sing the National Anthem.

54.title: Russia claims it shot down Ukrainian military plane carrying weapons
54.article_body: Russia on Saturday said its forces have shot down a Ukrainian military transport plane carrying weapons and munitions near the Black Sea port of Odesa. A missile strike in the same region hit an outpost for "foreign mercenaries", Russia's Defence Ministry said. Russian missiles also struck an artillery training centre in Ukraine's Sumy region where foreign instructors worked, it added.

55.title: Would like to break Wayne Rooney's record of most goals: Kane
55.article_body: English footballer Harry Kane has said that he would "like" to break Wayne Rooney's record of the highest number of international goals for England. "I would like to break it as soon as possible, I'd love to score as many goals as I can in the next four games before the World Cup," Kane said.

56.title: Yami, Aditya Dhar share video from their wedding on 1st anniversary
56.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam and her filmmaker-husband Aditya Dhar took to their respective social media handles to share a video from their wedding on their first wedding anniversary. "For all you do, for who you are, I will be forever grateful you are in my life. Happy 1st Anniversary!" they captioned the video. The duo got married in Himachal Pradesh.

57.title: WinZo sues MPL for allegedly copying its game format 'World War'
57.article_body: WinZo has sued Mobile Premier League (MPL) over alleged copyright infringement related to its game format called 'World War'. WinZo claims in March it found out MPL had copied one of its proprietary formats 'World War' with an identical name. MPL took down the format after it was notified but allegedly restarted using it under a different name in April.

58.title: Enemies triggering unrest in Iran to overthrow govt: Supreme Leader
58.article_body: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday said that foreign enemies are seeking to overthrow the Iranian government through the recent public protests. "But the enemies' calculation is as wrong as many earlier ones," he added. Khamenei was referring to the protests that began after the collapse of a building in southwestern Iran last month.

59.title: BESCOM speeds up drive against unauthorised cables in Bengaluru
59.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has said that it has sped up a drive against unauthorised cables laid at its transformer units and poles. The move is aimed at avoiding potential accidents, officials said. Notably, a man had died after he accidentally came in contact with a live wire drawn illegally for a hoarding in May, an official said.

60.title: AAP to contest on all 182 seats in upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls
60.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat Assembly elections, Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia announced that the party will be contesting the polls on all 182 seats in the state. "Till now, the people of Gujarat didn't have an option, but now they have one," he said in Vadodara. AAP had made its debut in Gujarat in the 2017 Assembly polls.

61.title: Masaba shares mom Neena's pic with Mother Teresa on her birthday
61.article_body: Actress and fashion designer Masaba Gupta took to her Instagram handle on Saturday to share some old pictures of her mother, actress Neena Gupta, on her birthday. In one of the pictures, Neena can be seen interacting with Mother Teresa. "I mean, find me a more powerful icon! THE GREATEST! Happy Birthday, Mom," Masaba wrote. Neena turned 63 on Saturday.

62.title: China to launch next crewed mission for space station construction on Sunday
62.article_body: China will launch a spacecraft to the core module of the Chinese space station with three astronauts on Sunday. This will be the third of four crewed missions and the seventh of 11 missions needed to complete the construction of the space station. The astronauts will work and live at space station for six months as construction enters advanced stages.

63.title: CCTV footage shows Hyderabad gangrape accused & the survivor outside pub
63.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced showing the accused in the gangrape case of a minor girl in Hyderabad. The footage shows four of the accused leaving the pub where the 17-year-old rape survivor reportedly met them during a party. The survivor is also seen in the footage. Three of the five accused in the case have been arrested.

64.title: Man stabs doctor, nurses inside emergency ward in US hospital; held
64.article_body: A man stabbed a doctor and two nurses inside an emergency ward of a hospital in California on Friday after asking for treatment for anxiety, authorities said. After the stabbing, accused remained inside the emergency room for hours before police arrested him. The attack comes two days after a gunman killed four people and then himself at an Oklahoma hospital.

65.title: Govt orders suspension of body spray Layer'r Shot's ads having gang rape jokes
65.article_body: The Information and Broadcasting Ministry has ordered suspension of controversial deodorant advertisements by Layer'r Shot. An inquiry is being held as per the advertising code. It asked Twitter and YouTube to take necessary actions for the removal of the advertisements. The advertisements, featuring a group of men and a woman, have been accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape.

66.title: Sad situation: Blake on Zverev retiring from French Open semis due to injury
66.article_body: Reacting to world number three Alexander Zverev retiring from French Open 2022 semi-final against Rafael Nadal after rolling his ankle towards the end of second set, ex-world number one Ana Ivanovic tweeted, "Get well soon Zverev! Wishing you a speedy recovery." James Blake tweeted, "What a sad situation for Zverev in...semis. Never want to see a match end like this."

67.title: Bihar govt will take suggestion on caste census: Nitish Kumar
67.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has said that the state government will take "suggestions" from all political parties on the caste-based census which will be conducted by the state. "Decisions have been made on caste-based census and the department is already preparing for it. We'll keep informing parties about it and take suggestions from them," CM Nitish said.

68.title: Ravi Shastri shares pic of Audi 100 that he won in 1985 after getting it fully restored
68.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to share pictures of Audi 100 car that he won in 1985 after getting it fully restored. "This is as nostalgic as it can get! This is a national asset. This is Team India's Audi," he wrote. Shastri was named 'Champion of Champions' at the 1985 World Championship of Cricket.

69.title: Google cancels talk by Dalit activist after some employees protest; sr manager quits
69.article_body: Google cancelled a scheduled talk by US-based Dalit activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan in April after some employees sent emails calling her "Hindu-phobic" and "anti-Hindu", the Washington Post reported. Following this, Google News' Senior Manager Tanuja Gupta, who had invited Soundararajan to speak, has resigned. Google said the talk was cancelled because it "was creating division and rancour".

70.title: Heatwave predicted in several states over 5 days, Iist released
70.article_body:
According to IMD, heatwave in isolated places is very likely over Rajasthan, Jammu Division, Himachal
Pradesh, Uttarakhand, south Punjab and south Haryana-Delhi on June 4 and 5. Heatwave is also likely in Vidarbha, Jharkhand, interior Odisha and Chhattisgarh during June 4-6 and over south Uttar Pradesh and north Madhya Pradesh during June 4-8.

71.title: Mariah sued for $20 million for allegedly copying 'All I Want For...'
71.article_body: Singer-songwriter Mariah Carey is being sued for $20 million (over ₹155 crore) for allegedly copying the lyrics of her 1994 song 'All I Want For Christmas Is You'. Andy Stone has claimed that Mariah's song is copied from the song he co-wrote for Vince Vance & the Valiants in 1989 and he never gave permission for it to be used.

72.title: Sidhu Moosewala's parents meet Home Minister Amit Shah in Chandigarh
72.article_body: Days after singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district, his parents met Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday in Chandigarh. Moosewala's father had written a letter to Shah, seeking an investigation by a central agency into his son's killing. Earlier, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann met Moosewala's parents in Moosa village.

73.title: Police stop Varanasi seer from going to Gyanvapi to offer prayers
73.article_body: The police on Saturday stopped Swami Avimukteshwaranand, a seer at Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, from going to the Gyanvapi complex to offer prayers. Following this, the seer said, "Until I'm not given permission to worship the Shivling in Gyanvapi, I won't eat anything." Earlier, the seer had claimed that he and 70 others will offer prayers at the 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi.

74.title: Vicky Kaushal's 'Sardar Udham' wins 3 IIFA technical awards
74.article_body: Vicky Kaushal-starrer 'Sardar Udham' won in three categories at the 2022 IIFA technical awards including best cinematography, best editing and best special effects (Visuals). 'Atrangi Re' starring Sara Ali Khan, Dhanush and Akshay Kumar won best choreography for 'Chaka Chak' and best background score for AR Rahman. 'Shershaah' which featured Sidharth Malhotra won the best screenplay award.

75.title: Words can't express how much you inspired me: Shirley Setia on KK
75.article_body: Singer Shirley Setia penned a note remembering singer KK who passed away on Tuesday evening. "Met you three times and every time I couldn't gather...courage to speak...with you...yet you...heard me, and always wished me well," Shirley wrote while sharing a picture with the late singer. "Words will not express how much you and your music have inspired me," she added.

76.title: It's great that Rahane, Ishant have been dropped from Test squad: Hogg
76.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said it is "great" that batter Ajinkya Rahane and pacer Ishant Sharma have been dropped from Team India's Test squad. "They have been ageing and haven't been performing of late," added Hogg. "You need to get the youth in and rotate them so that they get experience alongside those who are already experienced," stated Hogg.

77.title: Cycling in Pune 1 min slower than car drive over same distance: NGOs
77.article_body: After conducting an experiment, NGOs Save Pune Traffic Movement (SPTM) and Parisar have found that cycling in Pune is just 45 seconds to one minute slower than driving a car over a one-kilometre distance. The NGOs said the experiment demonstrated that bicycles are faster than cars when congestion is higher. More people can be encouraged to use bicycles, they added.

78.title: Fire breaks out at cargo bay of Delhi airport, no casualty reported
78.article_body: A fire broke out at the cargo bay of Delhi airport after a pushback towing vehicle reportedly caught fire at 5:25 pm on Friday. "Fire brigade immediately reached the location and controlled the fire," airport officials present there said. Though a video of the incident showed several passenger planes present at the spot, no casualties were reported.

79.title: Intelligence services in communication with captured fighters: Ukraine
79.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Minister Denys Monastyrskiy said the country's intelligence services are in communication with fighters captured at the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol. "It's through them [intelligence services] that we're learning about the conditions of the detention, nutrition and the possibility of their release," he added. In May, Russia said about 2,000 Mariupol fighters had surrendered.

80.title: She is my goddaughter: Anusha Dandekar on adoption rumours
80.article_body: After posting a picture with a baby writing, "I finally have a little girl I can call my own," Anusha Dandekar took to Instagram Stories to clarify that the baby is not adopted but her goddaughter. Anusha wrote in another story, "I am the God Mother...I vow to look after her...She's like a daughter to me...BUT NOT my real daughter."

81.title: KK was never mobbed at concert, AC was working: Police on 'mismanagement' claims
81.article_body: After several claims of 'mismanagement' of singer KK's concert emerged after his death, the Kolkata Police have said there was sufficient police presence at the venue. "At no point of time was he (KK) mobbed," said Kolkata Police Commissioner Vineet Goyal. He said there was never a situation where people were short of space and the air-conditioning was working.

82.title: Sheryl told people she felt burned out & had become a punching bag at Meta: Report
82.article_body: Sheryl Sandberg recently stepped down as Meta's COO after 14 years at the company. According to a report, Sheryl had been talking to people about how she "felt burned out" and that she increasingly felt "like a punching bag" for the company's problems. She sees herself as someone who has been targeted, said a person who worked with her.

83.title: Uma Thurman to play US President in 'Red, White & Royal Blue'
83.article_body: Uma Thurman has signed on to star in Prime Video's upcoming film 'Red, White & Royal Blue'. The actress will portray US President Ellen Claremont in the romantic-comedy. The film is based on the novel of the same name by Casey McQuiston, reported Deadline. Directed by Matthew Lopez, the film also features Nicholas Galitzine and Taylor Zakhar Perez.

84.title: 'Heeramandi' to be made on a budget of ₹200 cr, Bhansali to get ₹65 cr: Report
84.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali's web series 'Heeramandi' will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore. "Bhansali will be pocketing around ₹60-65 crore rupees as directorial fee, the rest of the 200-crore budget for 'Heeramandi' goes into production costs and in paying...actors," a source told Bollywood Hungama. It'll reportedly feature Sonakshi Sinha, Manisha Koirala, Huma Qureshi and Richa Chadha.

85.title: UEFA apologises to fans for 'distressing events' at Champions League final
85.article_body: UEFA has issued an apology to the fans for the chaos due to the alleged ticket fraud at the Champions League final last week in Paris. "UEFA wishes to sincerely apologise to all spectators who had to experience...distressing events in the build-up to the UEFA Champions League final. No football fan should be put in that situation," UEFA said.

86.title: Boosting Delhi's groundwater level to ensure 24×7 supply to all: CM
86.article_body: After inspecting the Rohini sewage treatment plant, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the AAP government is working on increasing production capacity by recharging groundwater to provide 24×7 water supply to all houses in the city. He added that the government is working on a unique mix of natural and scientific methods to prevent sewage from flowing into river Yamuna.

87.title: Take pre-emptive action to control COVID: Union Health Secretary to Maha
87.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan wrote to Maharashtra's Additional Chief Secretary Dr Pradeep Vyas to take pre-emptive action to control the spread of COVID-19 in the state. He has asked the state to follow test, track, treat, vaccination and COVID-19 appropriate behaviour strategy. The weekly COVID cases rose in 6 districts, including Mumbai, Mumbai Suburban, Pune, Thane, Raigad and Palghar.

88.title: Body spray Layer'r Shot's ads accused of promoting rape, gets notice
88.article_body: Responding to outrage over an advertisement by Layer'r Shot, Advertising Standards Council of India said the ad is in "serious breach" of their code and against public interest. Layer'r was criticised over two advertisements. Both videos feature a group of men and a woman, wherein the men talk about taking a "shot". Several viewers accused the ads of promoting rape.

89.title: Losing musicians is very cruel: Rahman on KK, Lata Mangeshkar's death
89.article_body: AR Rahman, while speaking to media at IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi, spoke about the musicians who passed away recently. "Losing musicians is very...cruel because every time they take you to another space," he said, adding, "I'm really...sad about losing Lata (Mangeshkar) ji, KK and SP Balasubrahmanyam. The list goes on but I think...world is societal, it keeps going on."

90.title: 2 killed, 3 injured after bus hits car on highway in UP's Gonda
90.article_body: Two people died while three got injured after a car collided with a bus on a highway in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda on Saturday. The two deceased, identified as Chand Babu (30) and Khuddan (58), were travelling in the car while the three injured were bus passengers, police said. Notably, the injured have been sent to Balrampur district hospital.

91.title: Their families are 'poor' in values, not 'influential': Mahindra on Hyd gangrape accused
91.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared an article about the recent gangrape of a minor in Hyderabad which reported the accused are from "influential families". Mahindra said, "I don't know these boys but may I suggest that the headline is inappropriate? These boys are not from 'influential' families but from 'poor' families. Families that are 'poor' in culture, upbringing and human values."

92.title: New York passes 'right to repair' bill for electronics, first US state to do so
92.article_body: The New York state legislature has passed the 'right to repair' bill covering electronics, becoming the first state in the US to do so. The 'Digital Fair Repair Act' requires manufacturers of digital electronic products to make tools, parts, and instructions for repair available to consumers and independent shops. The measure will take effect one year after it becomes law.

93.title: Plogging drive held in Pune ahead of Plogathon 2022; pics surface
93.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Saturday shared pictures from a plogging drive organised by the Radio Mirchi team at Pune's Porwal Road. The drive was conducted ahead of the 'Pune Plogathon 2022: Mega Drive' which will be held on June 5. Plogging is defined as a "combination of jogging and picking up litter", according to the PMC.

94.title: Woman injured after IPS officer creates ruckus at birthday party in Delhi
94.article_body: A woman suffered injuries after an IPS officer posted in Delhi created ruckus at birthday party hosted by a businessman at a cafe and bar in Kailash Colony on Friday. His friends reportedly tried to stop him, but he started throwing glasses, one of which hit the woman standing near him. She was rushed to Max hospital where she's recuperating.

95.title: Person booked for wheeling in Bengaluru; traffic police share video
95.article_body: A case was registered against a person and his two-wheeler was confiscated after he was seen wheeling on the road in Bengaluru, according to the city's DCP Traffic East. The traffic police also shared a video of the incident on their Twitter handle. "If you are wheeling, we are waiting to book (a) case against you," the traffic police said.

96.title: Victims won't be forgotten: US on China's Tiananmen Square anniversary
96.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said the efforts of the victims of China's crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Beijing's Tiananmen Square 33 years ago will "never be forgotten". China hasn't revealed how many people were killed when the army used live ammunition to clear Tiananmen Square protesters. China bans any public commemoration of the June 4 event on the mainland.

97.title: Banks willing to finance Reliance-Apollo bid for UK pharma chain Boots: Report
97.article_body: Lending banks are reportedly willing to finance a joint bid by Reliance Industries and US-based Apollo Global Management in case they acquire UK pharmacy chain Boots. Currently, the drugstore chain is owned by Walgreens Boots Alliance. Walgreens put up Boots for sale in December last year and has been seeking a valuation of about £7 billion for it.

98.title: Four onion traders die after being hit by unidentified vehicle in Karnataka
98.article_body: An unidentified vehicle killed four onion traders and injured one while they were changing their truck's tyre on National Highway-218 in Karnataka's Bagalkote. The deceased, identified as Malleshi Shankrappa Malali (42), Ramaswamy Mahadevappa Karigar (36), Razak Tamboli (54) and Nasir Mulla (42), were going to Bengaluru to sell onions, police said. Notably, the accused is still absconding.

99.title: Man rapes 9-year-old girl at factory in Northeast Delhi; arrested
99.article_body: A 46-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a nine-year-old girl inside a factory in the New Seelampur area of Northeast Delhi. According to police, the accused, who was known to the girl, lured her while she was playing on the street and raped her in the factory where he works. The girl is reportedly suffering from mental health disorders.

100.title: Hyderabad police make 3rd arrest in 17-yr-old girl's gang-rape case
100.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested the third accused in connection with the gang-rape of a 17-year-old girl. The girl was gang-raped in a car by five persons she met at a party. Three persons have been arrested in the case, out of which two are juveniles, police said. They are being produced before juvenile court, police added.

101.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' becomes third-biggest Bollywood opener of 2022
101.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj' has received the third-biggest opening of the year for a Bollywood film, as per a tweet by Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh. It has earned ₹10.7 crore on the first day of its release. Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' received the biggest opening, earning ₹14.11 crore, followed by 'Bachchhan Pandey', which earned ₹13.25 crore.

102.title: Rahul is at his best in T20s, captaincy will fire him up further: Shastri
102.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said opener KL Rahul is at his "very best" in T20 cricket, adding Rahul will be fired up even more after being named India's captain for the upcoming T20I series against South Africa. "Over the last two or three years, he has been one of the most consistent players in this format," stated Shastri.

103.title: Hizbul commander killed in encounter in J&K, 3 soldiers injured
103.article_body: A self-styled commander belonging to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit was reportedly killed in an overnight encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, police said on Saturday. Incriminating materials, arms and ammunition including one AK-47 rifle have been recovered from him. Three soldiers and one civilian were also injured in the encounter. They were airlifted to an army hospital in Srinagar.

104.title: US' Ohio to let teachers carry guns after 24 hours of training
104.article_body: Governor of US' Ohio state Mike DeWine said that he'll sign a bill into law that will allow teachers and staff to carry guns in schools after completing up to 24 hours of initial training. The bill, which passed the Ohio General Assembly this week, was finalised ten days after a gunman killed 19 children at a Texas elementary school.

105.title: I prefer to lose French Open final and get a new foot: Rafael Nadal
105.article_body: After reaching his 14th French Open final, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said, "I prefer to lose the final and get a new foot that allows me to be happier in my day-to-day life." "Winning is nice and fills you with momentary joy. But life goes on," added Nadal, who is suffering from a chronic foot injury.

106.title: Take action by rising above religion, caste: Mayawati over Kanpur violence
106.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday, while reacting to the violence in Kanpur, urged the UP government to take action "by rising above religion, caste and party politics". "Government has to understand that in...absence of law and order, how investment and development are possible in the state?" Mayawati tweeted. Notably, three people including a police officer were injured in the violence.

107.title: Masks must in closed public spaces: Maharashtra health department's Add'l Chief Secy
107.article_body: Wearing masks has been made mandatory in closed public spaces in Maharashtra, as per a letter by the state Public Health Department Additional Chief Secretary Pradeep Vyas to district authorities. Masks will now be a must in public spaces like buses, cinemas and schools, Vyas said. This comes as Maharashtra reported over 1,000 daily cases for the past three days.

108.title: Gujarat Congress leader whose wife caught him with woman takes break from politics
108.article_body: After his wife caught him with a woman, ex-Union minister and Gujarat Congress leader Bharatsinh Solanki announced that he would be taking a break from politics for a few months. "We have not lived together for many years," the Congress leader said about his wife. He added that his wife had even contacted an exorcist to take his life.

109.title: Railways officer, 2 others held in bribery case by CBI in Lucknow
109.article_body: An officer in the Lucknow division of the Northern Railways was arrested by the CBI for allegedly accepting a bribe of ₹80,000. The Deputy Chief Materials Manager (carriage and wagons) Alok Mishra was arrested along with two other people, identified as Avanish Mishra and Manjit Singh, CBI said. Also, unidentified public servants and private persons have been booked too.

110.title: Didn't want to look into a mirror: Masaba recalls struggle with acne
110.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta revealed that she suffered from acne when she was 12 years old. "What would you tell a 12-year-old who didn't want to look into...mirror for years...Thanks to acne blowing up on her face overnight...But she survived it all," she said. Masaba further said her mother, Neena Gupta, helped her overcome the difficult phase of her life.

111.title: Salman shares teaser of SRK's 'Jawan', says 'Mera jawaan bhai ready hai'
111.article_body: Salman Khan took to Instagram to share the teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan'. "Mere jawaan bhai ready hai @iamsrk," he captioned the post. The film will be directed by Atlee, who has previously helmed films like 'Bigil' and 'Mersal'. 'Jawan' is slated to release in June 2023, in multiple languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

112.title: Facing Nadal in French Open final is an impossible task: Casper Ruud
112.article_body: Discussing his upcoming French Open 2022 final against Rafael Nadal, Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said facing Nadal in a French Open final sounds like an "impossible" task. "[Playing] Rafa in a Roland Garros final is...the greatest challenge there is in this sport...He's 13-0 in the finals," added Ruud. "I will need to play my best tennis ever," stated Ruud.

113.title: Cameras with face recognition feature installed at Gurugram's MG Road Station
113.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) has installed eight cameras with face recognition technology at the entry and exit gates of MG Road Metro Station in Gurugram. The cameras will be used for general surveillance and for tracing people, a GMDA official said. Currently, 1,130 CCTV cameras are operational at 212 junction locations in the city.

114.title: Man's head smashed with bricks, stabbed to death by 2 brothers in broad daylight in Delhi
114.article_body: Two brothers allegedly stabbed and beat a 28-year-old man to death in broad daylight after the latter demanded money from one of them for drugs in Delhi on Friday, police said. CCTV footage of the incident purportedly shows the deceased's head being smashed with bricks. One of the accused has been arrested, while the other is absconding, police added.

115.title: Goa govt launches 'Beach Vigil App' to report violations along beaches
115.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Friday launched 'Beach Vigil App' to report violations along the state's beaches directly to the tourism department. The app will allow users to report violations like drinking on the beach, unattended litter and other illegal services. In the first phase, the app will open for tourism department officials, Drishti workers, police and other stakeholders.

116.title: BigBasket gets ₹350 cr from holding company: Filings
116.article_body: Grocery delivery unicorn BigBasket has received ₹350 crore from holding company Supermarket Grocery Supplies, filings from business intelligence platform Tofler showed. This latest investment was approved on May 24. BigBasket had received ₹1,000 crore from its holding company, ET had reported in April. The investment comes months after BigBasket acquired Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech.

117.title: Mexican city limits water access to 6 hours a day amid drought
117.article_body: A city in Mexico's Nuevo Leon state is limiting daily water access to residents to just a six-hour window amid historic drought in the region, authorities said. Monterrey city, which is home to 5.3 million people, will allow water use from 4 am to 10 am daily. The earlier policy restricted water to one day per week based on location.

118.title: Woman testifies US comedian Bill Cosby forcibly kissed her in his trailer when she was 14
118.article_body: During a civil trial against US comedian Bill Cosby, a woman testified that Cosby forcibly kissed her after inviting her into his trailer in Los Angeles in 1975 when she was 14. "He started kissing me...all over my face...tongue down my throat," she said. She claimed he led her into his trailer to help him fix his bow tie.

119.title: I thought it would never land: Ashwin on India's flight from Melbourne to Sydney in 2021
119.article_body: Recalling Team India's flight from Melbourne to Sydney during their 2020-21 tour, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "We were flying to Sydney and the flight encountered a thunderstorm." He added, "It was so scary that for a moment, I thought the flight would never land." Ashwin had even tweeted about the incident in 2021, writing, “Yours Turbulently, Melbourne to Sydney! #ouch #scary."

120.title: Hyderabad's Nampally railway station gets EV charging facility
120.article_body: An electric vehicle (EV) charging facility has been set up at the Nampally railway station in Hyderabad. The facility falls under a contract awarded by the Secunderabad Railway Division to set up EV charging facilities at 32 stations within its limits. The initiative will not only provide an important passenger amenity but also generate revenue for railways, an official said.

121.title: Have a super bad feeling about economy: World's richest man Elon Musk
121.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in an email titled "pause all hiring worldwide" for his employees, reportedly wrote that he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy. He added that Tesla would need to cut about 10% of the salaried staff. After the report about his email emerged, the company's shares fell 9% on Friday.

122.title: My ankle injury is very serious, very difficult moment for me: Zverev
122.article_body: Talking about his ankle injury during his French Open 2022 semi-final against Rafael Nadal which resulted in him being taken off the court in a wheelchair, world number three Alexander Zverev said his injury is "very serious". "Very difficult moment for me today on the court," added Zverev. Zverev retired in the middle of the match's second set.

123.title: Honey Singh bows down at AR Rahman's feet during IIFA Awards; video viral
123.article_body: A video showing rapper Yo Yo Honey Singh bowing down at AR Rahman's feet during IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi has gone viral on social media. In the video, Honey can be seen singing on the stage before he walks up to Rahman and bows down at his feet. "Moment of my life with AR Rahman sir," Honey said.

124.title: I shared my heartbreaks with mom, she was non-judgmental: Mohnish on Nutan
124.article_body: Actor Mohnish Bahl, remembering his late actress-mother Nutan on her 86th birth anniversary, said that she was non-judgmental. "All the pains and tribulations of a teenager's love life, all the heartbreaks I shared with her," he added. "'Time moves on, things pass. Life doesn't end at any point' would be her kind advice," Mohnish further said.

125.title: A Manimekhalai appointed as 1st woman MD & CEO of Union Bank of India
125.article_body: The Centre has appointed A Manimekhalai as the MD and CEO of Union Bank of India for a period of three years with effect from the date of assumption of office. Notably, Manimekhalai will be the first woman to hold these positions at the bank. She will replace Rajkiran Rai G, who held these positions since 2017.

126.title: 178 women workers fall ill after gas leak at chemical plant in Visakhapatnam
126.article_body: At least 178 women fell sick after inhaling poisonous gas following a gas leak at the laboratory of a chemical plant in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday. They complained of stomach pain, burning sensation in their eyes and nausea and were shifted to different hospitals. Officials are yet to confirm the name of the leaked gas and its source.

127.title: Crypto consumers lost over $1 bn in scams since Jan 2021: US FTC
127.article_body: The US FTC has said cryptocurrency consumers have reported losing over $1 billion in scams since January 2021. Nearly half the people said the scam started with an ad, post or a message on social media. The average reported loss for an individual was $2,600. The top three cryptocurrencies used by consumers to pay scammers were Bitcoin, Tether and Ether.

128.title: Man hacked to death in crowded market in Punjab; act caught on CCTV
128.article_body: A case has been registered after a 25-year-old man was hacked to death by six unidentified persons in full public view at a crowded market in Punjab's Moga on Friday. CCTV footage of the incident purportedly shows the deceased trying to defend himself with a sword that he was carrying. "[The deceased] neck was cut open," a police official said.

129.title: I've deleted the show from my life: Sadh on participating in Bigg Boss 1
129.article_body: Amit Sadh spoke about participating in 'Bigg Boss 1' and said, "I thought it'll be...about physical strength." He added he got bored after a week as "people just gossiped there". Amit further said he doesn't remember much about his stay in 'Bigg Boss' house, adding, "I said the day...I'll come out...I'll delete this show from my life, I did that!"

130.title: 85-yr-old woman dies after being robbed, attacked on head in Pune
130.article_body: An 85-year-old woman died after being robbed and attacked by an unidentified assailant at Moi village in Khed taluka of Pune district. The deceased, identified as Tanabai Yelwande, was allegedly attacked on her head by the accused and was robbed of her gold ornament when the former was out on her morning walk, police said.

131.title: Hardik showed faith in all those players whom nobody believed in: Saha
131.article_body: GT wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha said his team's captain Hardik Pandya showed faith in all those players whom "nobody" believed in. "He provided me with a stage to prove myself. [I can] never forget his contribution," added Saha. "[Hardik] has gone through a sea change. He used to be restless earlier but has changed completely now," stated Saha.

132.title: Not certain which player will get chances in future: Harbhajan on Rohit, Kohli
132.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, Harbhajan Singh said, "With the next generation coming up, it can't be said for certain which player will get opportunities." "They did not have a good IPL 2022. They will be hoping that they lead...[India] to a win in...T20 World Cup 2022," added Harbhajan. Rohit failed to hit a fifty in IPL 2022.

133.title: Shaan pays tribute to KK by singing 'Pal' at a concert, shares video
133.article_body: Singer Shaan paid tribute to late singer KK by singing his song 'Pal' at a concert. Sharing a video on Instagram, Shaan wrote, "Remembering Kakes...Don’t know why but that’s what [I] call him...Kakes." "Seeing the pictures in the background and the song it's too touchy...Really, it's hard to believe he is no more," a fan commented on the video.

134.title: 2 killed, 7 injured after mosque collapses during Friday prayer in UP
134.article_body: Two persons were killed and seven others were injured after the roof of an old mosque reportedly collapsed while they were offering prayers on Friday at Juda village in Uttar Pradesh. While 45-year-old Mulim Khan died on the spot, Ishad aged 32, succumbed to injuries later during treatment. Others trapped in the debris were rescued and rushed to the hospital.

135.title: RBI likely to go for another 0.40% rate hike in next policy review meet: Report
135.article_body: The RBI is expected to go for another rate hike of 0.40% at the review of the monetary policy next week, as per a report. The RBI panel will reportedly follow it up with a 0.35% hike in rates in the August review or it may opt for a 0.50% hike next week and a 0.25% increase in August.

136.title: 2 Reuters journalists injured, driver killed in eastern Ukraine
136.article_body: Reuters said two of its journalists were injured on Friday when the car they were travelling in came under fire in eastern Ukraine. The driver of the vehicle was killed. The attack occurred when "photographer Alexander Ermochenko and cameraman Pavel Klimov were travelling in a car provided by Russia-backed forces on...Russian-held part of the road between Sievierodonetsk and...Rubizhne", it added.

137.title: 36 arrested over violence after BJP leader's remarks on Prophet in UP
137.article_body: As many as 36 people were arrested and three FIRs were filed after violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, officials said on Saturday. The incident occurred following BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "Action under Gangster Act will be taken against conspirators and their property will be...seized or demolished," Kanpur Nagar Police Commissioner said.

138.title: Nehra would come specially to get me to bowl in the nets separately: Dayal
138.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal termed his team's head coach Ashish Nehra as a "blessing" and a "fatherly figure", adding that Nehra would come specially to get him to bowl in the nets separately. "When other people used to see me and him talk, they used to say that Ashish [sir] sees himself in me when he was young," stated Dayal.

139.title: Mamata inaugurated railway bridge without inviting Railways Minister: BJP MLA
139.article_body: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Friday inaugurated a railway bridge in Hooghly, BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari criticised the move claiming that she hadn't invited Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw or any railway authorities. Eastern Railway had spent "lion's share" for the bridge, he alleged. Earlier, Eastern Railway wrote to the state government about not being informed about the event.

140.title: Drug peddler arrested with 8 kg ganja worth ₹1.6 lakh in Hyderabad
140.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police arrested a drug peddler and seized 8 kg of ganja worth ₹1.6 lakh from his possession. According to police, the accused had previously been involved in over 25 offences and was released from jail last month. He used to buy the narcotic substance in Andhra Pradesh and sold it to needy customers in Hyderabad, police added.

141.title: Mexican megachurch leader pleads guilty to sexually abusing 3 girls
141.article_body: The leader of a Mexican megachurch being held in US has pleaded guilty to sexually abusing three children. Naasón García pleaded guilty to two counts of forcible oral copulation involving minors and one count of a lewd act upon a child aged 15. California state prosecutors said he'd also wielded his spiritual influence to have sex with many female followers.

142.title: It was a turning point for TVF: Jitendra on mimicking Kejriwal in spoof
142.article_body: Actor Jitendra Kumar spoke about mimicking Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in a TVF spoof and said it turned out to be the turning point for TVF. "After...[its] success, we got a lot of brand integration and...could eventually make Permanent Roommates," he added. "The video also reached him (Kejriwal) and he called...us to shoot another one with him," Jitendra further said.

143.title: Earlier, we used to hear about underworld in Mumbai, it has started in Punjab now: Mika
143.article_body: Talking about Sidhu Moosewala's murder, singer Mika said, "Earlier, we used to hear about the underworld in Mumbai, and now that underworld has started in Punjab, which is a very wrong message." He added that celebrities will stop coming to Punjab for shooting and shows. He further said that even singers Gippy Grewal and Mankirt Aulakh have got death threats.

144.title: Take care of your back during honeymoon, we have a WC ahead: Sister to Deepak Chahar
144.article_body: India fast bowler Deepak Chahar's sister Malti took to Instagram to share a picture from Deepak's wedding with Jaya Bhardwaj. "Ab ladki hui humari...Wish you guys a very happy married life...@deepak_chahar9 please take care of your back during your honeymoon...we have World Cup ahead," she wrote. Deepak missed the entire IPL 2022 due to a back injury.

145.title: This will reduce population of Hindus: BJP leader on 24-yr-old's plan to marry herself
145.article_body: Commenting on 24-year-old Kshama Bindu's decision to marry herself on June 11 at Vadodara's Harihareshwar temple, BJP leader Sunita Shukla said, "She'll not be allowed to marry herself in any temple. Such marriages are against Hinduism." "This will reduce the population of Hindus," Shukla further said. Bindu had said, "I had this idea in my mind for a long."

146.title: Restaurants free to raise prices but service charge is consumer's choice: Goyal
146.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal while speaking about the issue of service charges by hotels said that it is a "consumer's choice". He added, "Restaurants can charge whatever they want, there's no price control from the government's side...We've...said that restaurants cannot charge service charges on the bill...If...more benefits are to be given to employees, it cannot be forced on customers."

147.title: I don’t follow the records, the records follow me: Cristiano Ronaldo
147.article_body: Having recently broken the world record for scoring most goals in football history as claimed by his club Manchester United, Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I don't follow the records but the records follow me." "It's...my motivation to...[keep] working hard...and my teammates help me all the way so I have to appreciate all the people who help Cristiano," added the footballer.

148.title: Delhi govt does less work, more publicity: MoS Education Annapurna Devi
148.article_body: Minister of State for Education Annapurna Devi accused Delhi government of doing less work and more publicity in the education sector. "Instead of running...for votes, you should focus on providing quality education," she said. Her comments came after Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said the National Achievement Survey (NAS) must not turn into a high-stakes exam.

149.title: Putin made historic error by invading Ukraine: French Prez Macron
149.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday said that his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin had committed a "historic and fundamental error" by invading Ukraine. "I think he isolated himself,"  Macron added. However, the French President further said that Russia should not be "humiliated... so that the day the fighting stops, we can pave a way out through diplomatic means".

150.title: 22-yr-old woman arrested for killing partner in Greater Noida
150.article_body: A 22-year-old woman was held for allegedly murdering her 27-year-old partner by poisoning the latter and assaulting him to death in Greater Noida. The accused, identified as Rinki, allegedly committed the crime along with her brother and other suspects near Dadri on May 23, police said. The deceased, Gaurav Kumar, was assaulted after being fed poisonous food by Rinki.

151.title: 2nd arrest made by Hyderabad police in 17-yr-old girl's gang-rape case
151.article_body: Hyderabad police have made second arrest in 17-year-old girl's gang-rape case. The girl who went to a pub for a party was gang-raped inside a car. Earlier, West Zone DCP Joel Davis said that three of the five culprits who were identified are minors. One of the accused is a VIP's son, Davis had said.

152.title: India reports 3,962 new COVID-19 cases, 2,697 recoveries in last 24 hours
152.article_body: India has reported 3,962 COVID-19 cases, 2,697 recoveries in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,041 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 22,416, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,677, according to the latest data.

153.title: Who is Satyendra Nath Bose, Indian physicist honoured by Google today?
153.article_body: Google on Saturday honoured the renowned Indian mathematician and physicist Satyendra Nath Bose with a doodle. On June 4, 1924, Bose sent his quantum formulations to Albert Einstein, who immediately recognised it as a significant discovery. His theoretical paper became one of the most important findings in quantum theory. Born in 1894, Bose was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 1954.

154.title: Keep standby ambulance with doctor: Kolkata Police to event organisers
154.article_body: Kolkata Police have issued an advisory after Bollywood singer KK passed away soon after performing at a live concert and said, the event organisers must have an ambulance with a doctor outside the venue to ensure immediate medical assistance if needed. Excess entry passes must not be issued and police should be informed about the expected gathering beforehand, police said.

155.title: Twitter users compare SRK's look in 'Jawan' to Liam Neeson's in 'Darkman'
155.article_body: After Shah Rukh Khan shared the teaser of his upcoming film 'Jawan', several people on Twitter compared his look to Liam Neeson's bandaged look in the 1990 superhero film 'Darkman'. "Shah Rukh Ji...Haven't you seen Darkman 1990 Hollywood movie? Neeson getup," a user wrote, while another user wrote, "This is 100% 'inspired' by Sam Raimi's (director) underrated gem Darkman."

156.title: Who are we to say anything to Arjun when he has the great Sachin as his father: Kapil Dev
156.article_body: On being asked about Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar not featuring in MI's playing XI in IPL 2022, Kapil Dev said, "Why's everyone talking about him? Let him play his own cricket and don't compare with Sachin." He added, "Don't put pressure on Arjun...Who are we to say anything to him when he has the great Sachin as his father?"

157.title: Witness declared dead by CBI in journalist's murder case appears in Bihar court
157.article_body: A witness in the journalist Rajdeo Ranjan's murder case who was declared dead by CBI presented herself before the Muzaffarpur court on Friday. The court issued a show cause to CBI for submitting a false death report and directed it to submit its reply before June 20. Ranjan was shot dead in 2016 by a group of five men.

158.title: FIFA ban on India will be catastrophic not just for whole India but also for me: Chhetri
158.article_body: Talking about a possible FIFA ban on India after the Supreme Court put a team of administrators in charge of AIFF, Sunil Chhetri said, "That will be catastrophic, not just for the whole country but for me, because I'm 37." "I am playing my last games. You never know when there's a last game for you," he added.

159.title: 74 people injured as train collides with locomotive in Slovakia
159.article_body: At least 74 people were injured on Friday after a passenger train stopped due to a defect was hit by a locomotive that was coming to its aid in Slovakia. Of those wounded, four have sustained severe injuries and 34 people have been hospitalised, police said. There were around 100 people on the train at the time of the crash.

160.title: 24-yr-old claims she cracked UPSC in 1st attempt, later finds out it was an error
160.article_body: The family of 24-year-old Divya Pandey, who claimed she cracked civil services examination in her maiden attempt, apologised and said it was an "inadvertent error". Her family members added that it is actually one Divya P of South India who cracked the examination. Her elder sister said Divya was informed by her friend that she had secured 323rd rank.

161.title: Old tactic to disown unpopular things: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'Shivling' remark
161.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday criticised RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's Gyanvapi mosque speech, calling it "incendiary". Moreover, following Bhagwat's "Shivling" remark, Owaisi said that it's an "old Sangh tactic to disown things when they're unpopular". He also questioned "assurance" given by Bhagwat and BJP chief JP Nadda over the issue, adding that they both "hold no constitutional posts".

162.title: BMC covers over 3,600 manholes with protective nets across Mumbai
162.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon season, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has installed protective nets over 3,679 manholes across Mumbai. These nets will reportedly protect people from falling down manholes even if they are left open during flooding. "We have...appealed to residents not to remove the manhole cover in case of flooding in their areas," a BMC official said on Friday.

163.title: Not good for entrepreneurs to treat IPOs as 'surrogate' for financing: Narayana Murthy
163.article_body: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy on Friday remarked that IPOs are being treated as a "surrogate" for new rounds of financing by entrepreneurs and that this isn't a good thing. He said, "IPO comes with tremendous responsibility...so many people with very little money...put faith in us and put in their meagre disposable income, it is important to give them a...return."

164.title: India cannot just select a random team: Akhtar on T20 WC match vs Pak
164.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said India cannot just select a "random" team against Pakistan in their upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 match, without defining the roles of their players. "It won't be a walkover for Pakistan...There will be a crowd of 1,00,000 [at the MCG] out of which 70,000 will...[support] India, so the pressure will be on Pakistan," added Akhtar.

165.title: Delhi Metro to start 2 hours early on Sunday to facilitate UPSC examinees
165.article_body: Delhi Metro will begin a part of its train services two hours earlier than its scheduled time on June 5 to facilitate the candidates appearing for this year's UPSC's Civil Services (Prelim) Examination. However, this move will be applicable only in Phase-III sections which include Dilshad Garden-Shaheed Sthal, Mundka-Brigadier Hoshiar Singh and Janakpuri West-Botanical Garden, officials said.

166.title: Private news channel journalist shot at in Aligarh restaurant: Police
166.article_body: A private news channel journalist, Mukesh Gupta, was reportedly shot at by an unidentified person at a restaurant in Aligarh, police said. Another journalist who was present on the spot said, "The assailant walked up towards us...placed his pistol on Mukesh's neck and later fired towards his lower abdomen." Mukesh was rushed to hospital and is currently out of danger.

167.title: Ukrainian grain can be exported through Belarus: Putin
167.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia isn't obstructing grain export from Ukraine and western nations are trying to cover up their policy mistakes by blaming Moscow for problems in the global food market.  "If someone wants to solve the problem of exporting Ukrainian grain...the easiest way is through Belarus...But for this, you have to lift sanctions from Belarus," he added.

168.title: KK wasn't bothered about social media, he didn't even have WhatsApp: Shankar Mahadevan
168.article_body: Talking about late singer KK, Shankar Mahadevan said, "He used to talk about his family, take off on long holidays, cut off from the world." He added, "He wasn't bothered about social media...he didn’t even have WhatsApp. If you wanted to talk to him, you had to call him directly. He wasn’t worried about how many likes his songs got."

169.title: Woman protestor ties herself to the net during French Open semi-final, pics go viral
169.article_body: A woman protestor tied herself to the net during the French Open men's singles semi-final between Marin Cilic of Croatia and Norwegian Casper Ruud. The match was interrupted for 15 minutes. The woman was wearing a t-shirt that read 'We have 1028 days left' in reference to a UN report on climate change.

170.title: Mumbai reports 763 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Feb 4
170.article_body: Mumbai reported 763 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, the highest since February 4 when the figure was 846. While no new deaths were reported on Friday, the active cases in the city rose to 3,735. However, according to data published by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), the recovery rate currently stands at 98% and 95% of the positive patients are asymptomatic.

171.title: Car jumps over divider, hits truck in Pune; mother, daughter dead
171.article_body: A mother and her daughter were killed after the car they were in collided with a truck on Pune's Kiwale-Dehu road. The father lost control while driving the car, following which the vehicle jumped over the divider and came in front of the truck, according to police. The father and his son, who were in the car, are critically injured.

172.title: Marriott hotel chain to leave Russia after 25 years amid Western sanctions
172.article_body: The Marriott hotel chain has announced that it is suspending its operations in Russia after more than 25 years. The company said that the Western sanctions made it "impossible" for it to continue operations in the Russian market. In March, the company paused investment in Russia and closed its Moscow office following the invasion of Ukraine.

173.title: Edtech unicorn Eruditus fires some employees to focus on profitability
173.article_body: Mumbai-based edtech startup Eruditus has fired some of its employees from the marketing and talent acquisition teams as part of its business restructuring and to focus on profitability. While the company reportedly fired 80 employees, Co-founder Ashwin Damera said 40 of them resigned voluntarily. Eruditus turned unicorn in 2021 when it raised $650 million at a valuation of $3.2 billion.

174.title: Japan saw record low births, biggest-ever natural population drop in 2021
174.article_body: Japan, which has one of the fastest ageing populations on earth, saw record low number of births and the biggest-ever natural decline in the population in 2021, according to government data. There were 811,604 births last year, data showed. The country reported 1,439,809 deaths, leading to an overall drop of 628,205 in the population.
