175.title: Boating restarts in Bengaluru's Madiwala Lake after 3 years
175.article_body: The Karnataka Forest Department has restarted boating at Bengaluru's Madiwala Lake after three years. This comes after the state department gained custody of the water body from Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. "Visitors will have to pay a nominal fee of ₹10 for entry...We've retained the rates that we'd charged in 2019," Deputy Conservator of Forests (Bengaluru Urban) SS Ravishankar said.

176.title: 39-yr-old Pune man killed as his car hits tree, catches fire in MP
176.article_body: Police said a 39-year-old man from Pune, Sunil Sindappa, was killed after his car hit a tree and caught fire in Madhya Pradesh's Betul. As the car doors were stuck, the victim got trapped inside and was burnt alive, police said. Police added some locals tried to help him, but the tyres of the car burst, which made it difficult.

177.title: BJP govt in Gujarat ashamed of its schools: Manish Sisodia
177.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP government in Gujarat and said the state government was "ashamed" of its schools. "As part of the conference (National Conference of School Education), Education Ministers from other states were supposed to see the Gujarat Model," Sisodia said. He questioned why the ministers were not shown a single government school.

178.title: 5 people arrested in RTI activist murder case in MP's Vidisha
178.article_body: Police officials said that five persons including the alleged shooter were arrested in connection with the murder of an RTI activist in Madhya Pradesh's Vidisha. Ranjeet Soni, a former government contractor, was shot dead on Thursday evening. Police said that Soni allegedly used the Right to Information Act to harass other contractors, who decided to get him killed.

179.title: Our govt achieved in 8 yrs what others couldn't in 60 yrs: Thakur
179.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said the government has achieved in the past eight years what the previous government could not achieve in 60 years. "The Union Government under PM Narendra Modi has been able to sow seeds of development in the remotest corners of India," Thakur said. The gap between the rich and the poor has decreased, he added.

180.title: Hopefully, we can bring some joy to Sri Lanka: Finch ahead of Aus-SL series
180.article_body: Ahead of Sri Lanka-Australia all-format bilateral series amid Sri Lanka's worst-ever economic crisis, Australia limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch said, "Hopefully, we can bring some joy...entertainment to Sri Lanka." He added, "We're here[in Sri Lanka] to play cricket...this is the first time we're here since 2016, which is such a long gap." They'll play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

181.title: Amazon consumer CEO Dave Clark resigns after 23 years at the company
181.article_body: Amazon's CEO of Worldwide Consumer Business, Dave Clark, on Friday announced that he is resigning from his position after 23 years at the company. "I've had an incredible time at Amazon but it's time for me to build again," he tweeted. Clark had joined Amazon just a day after graduating from his MBA programme, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy said.

182.title: French volunteer fighter killed in Ukraine fighting Russian forces
182.article_body: A French volunteer fighter was killed in combat in Ukraine, France's Foreign Ministry said on Friday. "We remind everyone that the whole of Ukraine is a war zone. In this regard, travel to Ukraine is formally advised against, for whatever reason," it added. The French national had volunteered as a combatant to fight alongside Ukraine's military against the Russian forces.

183.title: Olympian Anjum Moudgil wins silver at ISSF Shooting World Cup 2022
183.article_body: Olympian Anjum Moudgil won a silver medal in 50m Rifle 3 Positions Women at ISSF Shooting World Cup 2022 in Baku on Friday. Anjum lost 12-16 in gold medal match against Denmark's Rikke Maeng Ibsen. In ranking match, Anjum finished second to Ibsen with a 406.5 to the Dane's 411.4. India are currently third in the standings.

184.title: Victory for Lalu ji: Tejashwi Yadav on caste-based survey in Bihar
184.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav called the approval of a caste-based survey in Bihar a victory for the former CM and his father Lalu Prasad Yadav as well as the people of Bihar. "This has been our cause from the beginning," Yadav said. The government has allocated a budget of ₹500 crore for the survey.

185.title: MLA's son not involved in gang-rape of 17-yr-old in car: Hyd Police
185.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday said an MLA's son, who was initially accused of being part of a 17-year-old girl's gang-rape, was not involved in the crime. West Zone DCP Joel Davis said three of the five culprits who were identified are minors and one of the accused has been arrested. One of the accused is a VIP's son, Davis added.

186.title: IIT Delhi student wins world's largest coding contest, gets ₹7.76 lakh
186.article_body: An IIT Delhi student has won the global coding contest, TCS CodeVita season 10, which saw the participation of 1,00,000 contestants from 87 countries. Computer Science Engineering student Kalash Gupta took home the top reward of $10,000 (around ₹7.76 lakh), a TCS press release said. CodeVita has been entitled the world's largest computer programming competition by Guinness World Records.

187.title: I get impression that India, Pak players want to play against each other regularly: Rizwan
187.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper Muhammad Rizwan has said that he gets the impression that India and Pakistan players want to play against each other regularly. He added, "But we can't do anything." He stated, "Everyone wants to see Pakistan and India play bilateral series or other matches but the state level affairs are not in the hands of the players."

188.title: Putin holds talks with head of African Union over grain exports
188.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and the Chairman of the African Union, Macky Sall, on Friday held talks on grain exports from Russia and Ukraine in an effort to ease a global food crisis. Russia has blockaded Ukrainian ports, disrupting the export of grains from Ukraine. Africa is heavily dependent on grain supplies from Russia and Ukraine, according to Reuters.

189.title: Trent Boult imitates Steve Smith's 'No run' impression during Lord's Test, video viral
189.article_body: A video has gone viral showing New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult imitating Australia batter Steve Smith's 'No run' impression while leaving a delivery during his team's first innings against England in the Lord's Test. "Giving Smith a tribute on his birthday," a fan tweeted. "He is putting up a show," wrote another.

190.title: India delivers 3.3 tonnes of medical supplies to Sri Lanka
190.article_body: India on Friday delivered 3.3 tonnes of medical supplies to a free pre-hospital care ambulance service in Sri Lanka amid a severe economic crisis. Notably, this comes after External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar was informed of shortages faced by Suwa Seriya ambulance service during his visit to Sri Lanka in March. The service was launched in 2016 with Indian aid.

191.title: Woman gives birth to one-in-200-million identical triplets in UK, pic surfaces
191.article_body: A first-time mother from Nottingham in the UK gave birth to one-in-200-million identical triplets. Zahra Amirabadi, 28, gave birth to her daughters Roya, Adina and Sefia in December last year. The triplets are known as spontaneous identical triplets. Two of the babies, Roya and Adina, were sharing a placenta, while Sefia was on her own.

192.title: This is why sport can make you cry: Shastri on Zverev getting injured in French Open semi
192.article_body:
Reacting to world number three Alexander Zverev retiring from French Open 2022 semi-final against Rafael Nadal due to ankle injury, Ravi Shastri tweeted, "This is why sport can make you cry. You will be back 
@AlexZverev." Shastri shared a picture of Nadal walking with Zverev. He further wrote, "@RafaelNadal- Sportsmanship, humility. Just brilliant and respect."

193.title: Boarding can't be denied to disabled people without medical opinion: DGCA draft rules
193.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued draft rules for onboarding persons with disabilities/special needs after IndiGo was fined for denying boarding to a disabled child. Airlines can't deny boarding on the basis of flyers' disabilities and a decision can only be taken after consulting with a doctor, they said. DGCA has sought airlines' comments on the rules.

194.title: India should send U-23 team for SAFF Championship: Chhetri
194.article_body: India should send its Under-23 team for SAFF Championship as the country has won the football tournament for a record eighth time, said Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri. He added that younger players will get international experience and "in the worst case scenario, we're going to lose". India won SAFF title in 2009 with its Under-23 side.

195.title: Bihar boy eats 'poisoned' chocolate given by his neighbour, dies
195.article_body: A Class 7 student died after eating chocolate in a village in Bihar's Bhojpur district, police said on Friday. The victim's father accused a woman, their neighbour who runs a grocery shop, of killing his son with the poisoned chocolate. Before his death, the boy claimed he was playing with other children when he received the chocolate from the woman.

196.title: Lots of luck on trip to the Moon: Biden as Musk raises concerns about economy
196.article_body: US President Joe Biden, when asked about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's comment about having a "super bad feeling" about the economy, said, "Lots of luck on his trip to the Moon." Biden also commented on Musk's plans to cut about 10% of Tesla's workforce and said, "While Elon Musk is talking about that, Ford is increasing their investment overwhelmingly."

197.title: Maha woman kills her daughter & son for crying, burns their bodies
197.article_body: A 30-year-old woman allegedly killed her four-month-old daughter and two-year-old son for crying incessantly and later burnt their bodies at a field in a village in Maharashtra's Nanded district, police said. Police arrested the accused, along with her mother and brother, who helped her dispose the children's bodies, an officer said. The killings took place two days in a row.

198.title: Certain results achieved: Russia on day 100 of conflict in Ukraine
198.article_body: As the war in Ukraine entered its 100th day, Russian government spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that Russia has achieved some results from its military campaign. "Many settlements have been liberated from the pro-Nazi armed forces of Ukraine and directly from nationalist elements," Peskov added. Russia will achieve all the goals of its military mission in Ukraine, he further said.

199.title: Dreams do come true: Anirudh on composing 'Jawan' score for SRK
199.article_body: Music composer Anirudh Ravichander on Friday took to Twitter to pen a note on composing the music score for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Jawan'. He wrote, "Dreams do come true! Scoring music for the Badshah himself. Thank you and so proud of my brother Atlee and this is going to be too special for us...Please bless us all."

200.title: 1 arrested for gang-rape of 17-yr-old girl in car in Hyd, 5 accused identified
200.article_body: The police on Friday said they have identified five people who allegedly gang-raped a 17-year-old girl in a Mercedes car in Hyderabad. One of the accused, identified as Saduddin Malik, has been arrested, police said. The incident had taken place on Saturday (May 28) when the girl was returning from a party. The accused reportedly belong to 'influential families'.

201.title: Nadal reaches his 14th French Open final after Zverev taken off in wheelchair over injury
201.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has reached his 14th French Open final after world number three Alexander Zverev injured his ankle and was taken off the court in a wheelchair in their semi-final. World number five Nadal had won the first set 7-6(10-8), while the second set was placed at 6-6 when Zverev retired after rolling his ankle.

202.title: Strangely not disappointed: Helly on not being invited to Cannes India Pavilion
202.article_body: Speaking about not being invited to the India Pavilion at 2022 Cannes Film Festival, actress Helly Shah said that she was strangely not disappointed. "Had I been invited I would have been very very happy and proud to represent my country," she added. Earlier, actress Hina Khan spoke about not being invited saying she was disheartened at the elitist system.

203.title: I miss him: MI bowling coach Bond on GT skipper Hardik
203.article_body: Calling Hardik Pandya a "pretty cool captain" after he led GT to IPL 2022 win in their debut season, MI bowling coach Shane Bond said he misses him. "It would've been nice to have him around in our team because he's a quality player. India need him too for...World Cup because he showed...what a good leader he is," he added.

204.title: Man found hanging in JNU campus, suspected to have died several days ago
204.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday found a highly decomposed body of a man hanging on a tree in the jungles of Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). Police said that the man appears to be in his forties. The body is yet to be identified and it has been sent for post-mortem. An inquiry has been initiated, the police added.

205.title: 4 killed, 30 injured after train derails in Germany: Police
205.article_body: At least four people were killed and 30 others injured after a train derailed in Germany's Bavaria on Friday, according to the police. "We grieve with the relatives of the victims and wish all who were injured a speedy recovery," the Governor of Bavaria said. Authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the accident.

206.title: Taliban faces threat from ISIS and new resistance: UN experts
206.article_body: Afghanistan's Taliban government faces military threats from the Islamic State (ISIS) and former Afghan government security personnel, UN experts said in a new report. Separately, the Taliban's primary concern has been to consolidate control "while seeking international recognition", the experts said. Notably, this comes amid a growing economic and humanitarian crisis in the country.

207.title: Provide security to Hindu community in J&K: Shiv Sena MP to Centre
207.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah urging him to provide adequate security to the Hindu community in Kashmir immediately. "Such targeted attacks...raise questions on the implementation of [govt] schemes...for the development and rehabilitation of Kashmiri migrants," she wrote. Chaturvedi's letter comes a day after a bank employee was shot dead in Kulgam.

208.title: Tough to say if I'll play next 5 years, not sure about 100 Tests: Umesh
208.article_body: When asked about reaching the 100-Test milestone, India pacer Umesh Yadav, who has played 52 Tests so far, said he's not sure it but he'll try to play as much as possible. "It's difficult to say whether I'll play for the next five years. I am just thinking about my small goals with each passing year," he stated.

209.title: ₹300 cr in Guj MLAs' Local Area Development funds remains unspent: ADR
209.article_body: More than ₹300 crore in the MLA Local Area Development (MLALAD) funds remains unspent in Gujarat, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). "The unspent amount...will expire once the Assembly term ends," it said. Of the ₹1,004 crore worth of development works, projects worth ₹677.5 crore had been completed by March this year, it claimed.

210.title: 1st pics of Moosewala's suspected killers surface, footage shows them at petrol pump
210.article_body: Days after the killing of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, images of the suspected murderers have surfaced. The suspected attackers were seen in a Bolero car in a petrol pump just hours before the murder of Moosewala. The police suspect that this is the same Bolero car that was used during the murder.

211.title: After Kashmir Files crossed ₹300cr, makers can bank on me: Darshan
211.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar stated that after 'The Kashmir Files' entered the ₹300 crore club, filmmakers who always wanted to work with him can now bank on him. The actor further said that OTT has changed the game for him and he is at the centre of things. "What I once wished...while joining the industry, I'm getting to live," he added.

212.title: Wanted to make horror film even kids can enjoy: 'Bhool...' director
212.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' director Anees Bazmee has said that he wanted to make a horror film that even children could enjoy without getting scared. The director further said that he realised with 2007 film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' that kids feared Manjulika but also got "kind of excited". 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' beat 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' to become 2022's biggest Hindi box office opener.

213.title: Man arrested with illegal arms & ammunition in West Bengal's Malda
213.article_body: Police said that a man was arrested with illegal arms and ammunition by the Special Task Force in West Bengal's Malda district. Three 7 mm pistols, six magazines and 18 rounds of bullets were recovered from him, police added. An investigation is underway to find from where he procured the arms and ammunition, they said.

214.title: Regulatory waiting period for Musk's $44 billion buyout deal is over: Twitter
214.article_body: Twitter on Friday said that the waiting period under the HSR Act for billionaire Elon Musk's $44-billion acquisition deal has expired. The deal's completion is now subject to remaining customary closing conditions, which include approval by Twitter stockholders and receipt of required regulatory approvals, Twitter said. The deal has cleared an antitrust review by the Federal Trade Commission.

215.title: BJP protests at Hyderabad police station as minor girl gangraped in car
215.article_body: BJP workers on Friday held a protest at the Jubilee Hills police station in Hyderabad. Security forces have been deployed at the site of the protest, which came after a 17-year-old girl returning from a birthday party was allegedly gangraped in a Mercedes car by five juveniles in Hyderabad. The protesting BJP workers were purportedly heard saying, "We want justice."

216.title: Many countries send back Indian tea over high pesticide content
216.article_body: Both international and domestic buyers have rejected a series of tea consignments due to presence of pesticides and chemicals beyond permissible limits, Indian Tea Exporters Association Chairman Anshuman Kanoria said. Kanoria added many countries are following strict entry regulations for tea. Most of the countries follow variations of EU standards, which are more stringent than FSSAI rules.

217.title: I've no doubt that Nadal's foot will last till the end of French Open: Moya
217.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal's chronic foot injury issues, his coach Carlos Moya said the 13-time champion's foot will undoubtedly last until the end of the ongoing French Open. "He will need it to beat Alexander Zverev [in semi-final], who is a great champion," he added. Nadal took four hours 12 minutes to beat defending champion Novak Djokovic in the quarter-final.

218.title: Harvey Weinstein's sex crimes conviction upheld by New York Court
218.article_body: A New York appeals court has upheld former Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein's sex crimes conviction. The 70-year-old was appealing his February 2020 conviction and 23-year prison sentence for assaulting former production assistant Mimi Haleyi and raping former aspiring actress Jessica Mann. In a statement, Weinstein's spokesperson said that his legal team was "disappointed but not surprised."

219.title: Centre taking strict action against terrorism in J&K: Himachal CM
219.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur condemned the killings in Jammu and Kashmir and said that the Centre is taking strict action against terrorism in the valley. "It's very unfortunate. We last witnessed targeted killings (in Jammu and Kashmir) in 1989-1990," Thakur said. Now the terrorists think that "a particular community may return" so they're targeting them again, he added.

220.title: KK didn't want to come out of car after seeing too much crowd at venue, claims singer
220.article_body: Singer Subhalakhmi Dey, who performed at the Nazrul Mancha auditorium on May 31 before KK's concert, said KK saw the crowd outside the auditorium and he didn't want to get out of his car at first. "There was too much crowd outside...the auditorium at the time KK arrived. KK arrived at 5:30 pm," she told India Today.

221.title: Journalist shot at while having dinner at Uttar Pradesh restaurant
221.article_body: A journalist was shot at by an unidentified assailant while having dinner inside a restaurant in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh, police said. The Chief Medical Officer (CMO) said the patient is out of danger as the bullet missed his vital organs. The accused had allegedly chased three other journalists present at the spot, but they managed to escape and inform police.

222.title: Makers believe I can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii': Nushrratt
222.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has stated that filmmakers believe she can do heavy roles after 'Chhorii' and 'Ajeeb Daastaans'. "There are some producers who have said, 'We can only think of you,' which is great. It has a lot to do with the body of work," the actress added. She further said that she was offered three women-led movies after 'Chhorii'.

223.title: I'm in favour of a strong opposition in country: PM Modi
223.article_body: Addressing an event at President Ram Nath Kovind's ancestral Paraunkh village in UP, PM Narendra Modi said that he is in favour of a strong opposition. Dynastic politics is throttling talent in the country, he added. Dynastic politics must stop so that anyone born in a village can become the PM and the President, he further said.

224.title: Govt approves 8.1% interest rate on EPF deposits for FY22, lowest in 4 decades
224.article_body: The central government has approved an interest rate of 8.1% on employee provident fund (EPF) deposits for 2021-22, news agency PTI reported citing an office order from the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). In March, the EPFO had lowered the rate to 8.1% from 8.5% in the previous year, marking the lowest EPF interest rate in more than 40 years.

225.title: It was a nightmare to face Wasim Akram: Jayawardena
225.article_body: On being asked the toughest bowler he has ever faced, ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said, "Hands down, Wasim Akram." He added. "I made my debut when he [Akram] was at his peak or...backend of his career...was a nightmare to face him as it was tough." Jayawardena made his international debut for Sri Lanka in 1997.

226.title: PMC to spend ₹170 crore for expansion of 24x7 water supply project
226.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that expansion of the 24x7 water supply project would cost around ₹170 crore. The project will have water supply infrastructure for 34 villages merged into the city civic limits. In the first phase of the project, work will be done in Bavdhan, Sus and Mhalunge.

227.title: Moosewala killed for revenge, I had no role in murder: Lawrence Bishnoi to police
227.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, while being interrogated by the Delhi Police, denied a role in singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, reports said on Friday. Bishnoi, however, told police that Moosewala was killed for revenge, reports added. Bishnoi and his aide Goldy Brar are among the prime suspects in the killing of Moosewala who was shot dead on Sunday (May 29).

228.title: Woman in US gets 3D-printed ear made from her cells in world-first transplant
228.article_body: A 20-year-old woman in US, who was born with a small and misshapen right ear, successfully received a 3D-printed ear implant made from her own cells. This is believed to be the first known example of a 3D-printed implant made of living tissues. The new ear will continue to regenerate cartilage tissue, giving it the appearance of a natural ear.

229.title: Bengaluru-based startup joins NASA's PACE mission
229.article_body: Bengaluru-based environment intelligence startup Ambee said that it will join NASA's PACE (Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem) mission. The mission aims to extend and improve satellite observations of global ocean biology, aerosols and clouds. "This collaboration with NASA and PACE scientists will allow us to develop in-depth solutions," Madhusudhan Anand, CTO and Co-founder of Ambee, said.

230.title: Visually-impaired woman seeking help to cross road in Delhi raped
230.article_body: A 24-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old visually-impaired woman near Sitapuri bus stand in Delhi's Dwarka. "When she asked locals to help her in crossing a road, the accused took her to a deserted lane and raped her," Dwarka DCP Shankar Choudhary said. Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal also met the survivor.

231.title: So proud: Ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama to Gauff on reaching 1st Slam final
231.article_body: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama took to Twitter to congratulate Coco Gauff after the 18-year-old American reached her maiden Grand Slam final at French Open on Thursday. "I'm so proud of you and I will be rooting for you all the way!" she wrote. The 18th seed defeated unseeded Martina Trevisan of Italy 6-3, 6-1 in the semi-final.

232.title: Stone-pelting in UP over BJP leader's remarks on Prophet, 17 held
232.article_body: Two groups clashed in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday over a call to shut down markets following recent controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. At least 17 persons have been detained following the incident, which also involved stone-pelting. As per reports, police used tear gas shells and resorted to lathicharge to bring the situation under control.

233.title: Pre-monsoon works completed in Mumbai, ready for rain: BMC
233.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said that it is fully prepared for the upcoming monsoon and said all pre-monsoon works including desilting of stormwater drains and trimming of trees have been completed in Mumbai. BMC also added that the situation would be reviewed periodically. This year, two additional NDRF teams will be deployed in areas which are prone to landslides.

234.title: Akshay wanted to reclaim history with 'Samrat Prithviraj': Director
234.article_body: 'Samrat Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that actor Akshay Kumar wanted to "reclaim our history" with the film. He added, "Akshay spoke to me and said, 'I'm ready to do the film...The current narrative of history is such where a section of people in India don't feel proud. Can we reclaim our history?' Soon, everything fell into place."

235.title: Centre writes to 5 states over rise in COVID-19 cases, issues advisory
235.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Health Secretaries of five states that have reported a rise in COVID-19 cases recently. He advised governments of Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Telangana, Maharashtra and Karnataka to "maintain strict watch and take pre-emptive action" to control COVID-19 spread. The states have been told to ensure adequate testing, send samples for genome sequencing etc.

236.title: Jaffer shares Salman's meme to troll Lord's pitch after 17 wickets fall in 1 day
236.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled Lord's pitch and took a dig at people who criticise Indian pitches, after 17 wickets fell on Day 1 of England-New Zealand Test. "When 17 wickets fall in a day at Lord's...talk is about skills of...bowlers. When 17 wickets fall in a day at Ahmedabad...talk is about conditions," Jaffer wrote, sharing a Salman Khan meme.

237.title: Rachakonda Police arrest drug peddler, drugs worth ₹30 lakh seized
237.article_body: The Rachakonda Special Operations Team along with the Meerpet Police busted an interstate drug syndicate and seized drugs worth ₹30.29 lakh. Police said that they arrested Parasmal alias Paras Seervi and seized 1 kg of opium, 5.2 kg of poppy straw, 2 kg of poppy straw powder and other materials. Another suspect named Deepak is absconding, the police said.

238.title: Mumbai taxi drivers unfairly targeted over minor offences: Union
238.article_body: General Secretary of Mumbai Taximen's Union AL Quadros criticised Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey and alleged that taxi drivers were 'unfairly targeted over minor traffic offences'. He further claimed that the police made matters worse for drivers by registering offences for honking. Drivers whose daily income is less than ₹300 cannot afford to pay such fines, Quadros added.

239.title: GHMC Mayor launches phase 4 of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' in Hyd
239.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said the fourth phase of 'Pattana Pragathi programme' was launched at NBT Nagar Banjara Hills division. This programme focuses on urban sanitation by desilting all drains, solid waste management and removal of construction and demolition debris, Gadwal added. The programme will be conducted from June 3 to June 15.

240.title: Nearly 60 kg expired meat seized during raid at Chennai restaurant
240.article_body: Tamil Nadu Food Safety Department officials have found nearly 60 kilograms of expired meat, including chicken and fish, after raiding a restaurant on Chennai's 100 Feet Road. The raid was conducted following a customer's complaint. Officials said the meat was stored in a damaged freezer box and the restaurant has been asked to shut down its kitchen for 15 days.

241.title: Happy 13 years to me & my dear 'Pavitra Rishta': Ankita Lokhande
241.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande shared pictures on social media to celebrate 13 years in the television industry and her show 'Pavitra Rishta'. "[Thank you] everyone for making this day so memorable. I loved each and every edit u guys have made...I love each and every one and so grateful for all the love [you] give," the actress wrote.

242.title: Police arrest girl & 2 friends for trying to snatch chain in B'luru
242.article_body: A girl student and two of her friends were arrested in Bengaluru for attempting to snatch a gold chain from an elderly woman, the police said. The girl had approached the elderly woman on the pretext of giving her a pamphlet. The police also said that the accused had tried to steal the chain to repay a loan of ₹5,000.

243.title: Amit Shah holds high-level security meeting over killings in J&K
243.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday held a high-level security meeting over the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. The meeting was attended by National Security Advisor Ajit Doval, J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Army Chief General Manoj Pande, among others. At least three civilians and two security personnel were killed in the Union Territory last month.

244.title: Europe believes its problems are world's problems, world's issues aren't Europe's: EAM
244.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar while speaking at a GLOBESEC discussion, said, "Europe has to get out of the mindset that Europe's problems are the world's problems but the world's problems are not Europe's problems." He said this in response to a question comparing the India-China conflict with the Russia-Ukraine war and India's stance on the Ukraine war.

245.title: We should save Kashmiri Pandits: Kangana on violence in J&K
245.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday took to Instagram Stories to react to the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir which were claimed by Lashkar-e-Taiba terror group's outfit The Resistance Front. Sharing a screenshot of a news article, she wrote, "We should save Kashmiri Pandits." Reportedly, nine people have been victims of targetted killings in the union territory since May 1.

246.title: People left hanging upside down as ride gets stuck at amusement park in US
246.article_body: Visitors at an amusement park in Pennsylvania, US were left hanging upside down on a ride after it malfunctioned and stopped mid-air. The incident took place on Monday at the Kennywood amusement park where the Aero 360 ride got stuck at the top. The riders were evacuated and officials said no one was hurt.

247.title: Who are India's top 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani tops the list?
247.article_body: Mukesh Ambani on Friday became India's richest person with a net worth of $99.7 billion, as per Bloomberg. He's followed by Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion), Azim Premji ($28.7 billion), and Shiv Nadar ($25.9 billion). The list of India's 10 richest people includes Lakshmi Niwas Mittal ($20.1 billion), Radhakishan Damani ($19.6 billion), Uday Kotak ($14.8 billion) and Dilip Sanghvi ($14.5 billion).

248.title: I'd call Hardik the junior version of Dhoni: GT spinner Sai Kishore
248.article_body: GT spinner Sai Kishore, who was with CSK before IPL 2022 season, said that GT skipper Hardik Pandya is the "junior version" of MS Dhoni, adding there are a lot of similarities between the two. "Much like Dhoni, Hardik has the knack of getting the best out of his players. Both put the team before themselves," he added.

249.title: Man arrested for beating 2 ragpickers to death in Pune
249.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly beating two unidentified ragpickers to death in Pune's Saswad area. The accused, identified as Nilesh alias Pappu Jaywant Jagtap, is a food cart owner and a resident of Tathewadi village in Saswad. Notably, the two deceased were aged between 50-60 years old, police said. Meanwhile, the accused also assaulted a 65-year-old female ragpicker.

250.title: I hope I do as good as Priyanka Chopra, Lara Dutta: Manushi Chhillar
250.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, in a recent interview, credited the Miss World platform for being noticed by Yash Raj Films (YRF). "I give a lot of credit to that platform, but it comes with the fact that people...have preconceived notions and certain expectations," she added. The actress stated that she hopes to do "as well as Priyanka Chopra or Lara Dutta did."

251.title: 87 women workers fall sick after gas leak at Andhra chemical plant
251.article_body: At least 87 women fell sick after a gas leak was reported at the laboratory of a chemical plant in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam on Friday. According to Anakapalle SP, all workers' health is currently stable and no casualties have been reported. Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy inquired about the gas leak and said that the incident should be investigated.

252.title: Never imagined I would be directing you: Atlee on working with SRK
252.article_body: Director Atlee on Friday penned a note on collaborating with actor Shah Rukh Khan for his upcoming film 'Jawan'. "Feeling emotional, excited and blessed. Grew up admiring you but never imagined that I would be directing you, sir," Atlee tweeted while sharing the film's teaser. Produced by Red Chillies Entertainment, 'Jawan' will release on June 2, 2023.

253.title: NATO should consider de facto membership for Ukraine: Defence Min
253.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Friday said that NATO should consider granting Ukraine "de facto" rather than "de jure" membership of the alliance. "It could be the good idea in this strategy," he added. Notably, NATO will discuss its strategy for the next 10 years at a summit in Spain's Madrid in June.

254.title: Doesn't matter what happens: 18-yr-old Coco Gauff on French Open final
254.article_body: American tennis player Coco Gauff, who is 18 years old, said the result of her upcoming French Open 2022 women's singles final against world number one Iga Swiatek "doesn't matter" to her. "There [are] so many things going [on] in the world...It's not important to stress over a tennis match," added Gauff. "My parents...[will] love me regardless," stated Gauff.

255.title: Politics should not be done: Delhi CM Kejriwal on Moosewala's murder
255.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that politics shouldn't be done over Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder. "Punjab Chief Minister [Bhagwant Mann] has said all efforts are on and he has assured that the culprits will be caught and punished," Kejriwal said. The AAP-led government faced criticism after Moosewala was killed just a day after it downgraded his security.

256.title: Russia-Ukraine war will have no winner, UN says on 100th day of fight
256.article_body: The ongoing Russia-Ukraine war "will have no winner", the UN said on Friday, as the fighting entered its 100th day. "This war has taken an unacceptable toll on people and engulfed virtually all aspects of civilian life...We've witnessed destruction and devastation across cities, towns and villages. Schools, hospitals and shelters haven't been spared," UN Assistant Secretary-General Amin Awad said.

257.title: Hopefully we can bring some joy to Sri Lanka: Finch ahead of SL tour
257.article_body: Ahead of Australia's tour to Sri Lanka, limited-overs skipper Aaron Finch has said that "hopefully" the team can bring "some joy" to crisis-hit Sri Lanka. "We are here to play cricket. Hopefully, we can bring some joy and entertainment to Sri Lanka...This is the first time we're here since 2016, which is such a long gap," Finch said.

258.title: Today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was: Narayana Murthy
258.article_body: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy while speaking at an event organised for startups, said, "I personally think that today's entrepreneurs are much smarter than I was." He added that there are three ingredients for success as an entrepreneur, namely, access to customer or market access, access to talent, and availability of venture capital funds.

259.title: SRK, Kajol's on-screen son Jibraan to return to films with Ishq Vishk sequel
259.article_body: Jibraan Khan, who portrayed Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol's son in 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham', is returning to films with 'Ishq Vishk Rebound', a sequel to Shahid Kapoor and Amrita Rao-starrer film 'Ishq Vishk'. Sharing a poster of the film on his Instagram handle, he wrote, "Dreams do come true." It will also star Hrithik Roshan's cousin Pashmina Roshan.

260.title: Roadies' Varun Sood joins Johar's talent management company DCA
260.article_body: Actor Varun Sood, known for participating in 'MTV Roadies', has joined Karan Johar's talent management company Dharma Cornerstone Agency (DCA). The official Instagram handle of DCA made the announcement on Friday, writing, "From Roadies to #JugJuggJeeyo, make way for digital sensation Varun Sood as he embarks on his acting journey!" Varun also appeared in the show 'Ragini MMS Returns'.

261.title: IIT grads-led startup Yojak lays off 60 full-time employees: Report
261.article_body: Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal and Info Edge-backed e-commerce platform Yojak has laid off more than 60 full-time employees over the last two months, media reports said. It has also laid off around 75-80 contractual workers. Founded by IIT Roorkee graduates Anuj Jain and Rachit Garg, Yojak is a B2B online marketplace of building materials.

262.title: Vote bank politics: Govt on US report alleging attacks on minorities in India
262.article_body: The government on Friday responded to a US State Department report, released by Secretary of State Antony Blinken, alleging that minority communities in India faced attacks in 2021. Calling Blinken's remarks "ill-informed", it said, "It's unfortunate that vote bank politics is being practised in international relations. We would urge that assessments based on...biased views be avoided."

263.title: Tata Projects to build Noida International Airport in UP's Jewar
263.article_body: Tata Group's infrastructure and construction arm, Tata Projects, has been selected to undertake the engineering, procurement and construction of the upcoming Noida International Airport in Uttar Pradesh's Jewar. "Tata Projects will work closely with Yamuna International Airport Private Limited (YIAPL) to deliver India's most advanced and environment-friendly airport on time," CEO Vinayak Pai said.

264.title: Success didn't change him: World no. 1 Swiatek on Nadal
264.article_body: Praising Rafael Nadal, world number one Iga Swiatek said success hasn't changed the 21-time Grand Slam champion and "he's still the same great person". She added, "He's that kind of a guy that's always saying 'hi'." She further said that Nadal inspires her in every aspect. Meanwhile, Swiatek will face 18th seed Coco Gauff in French Open final on Saturday.

265.title: 13-yr-old raped by cousin in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
265.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her cousin in Punjab's Hoshiarpur district. According to the police, the incident, which happened on the intervening night of May 30 and 31, took place on the roof of her house. Notably, the victim's parents had gone to Rajasthan to her grandfather's house when the incident took place, police said.

266.title: Man kills 2 women & then himself at church in US' Iowa
266.article_body: A man shot and killed two women before taking his own life in the parking lot of a church in US' Iowa on Thursday. Police believe it was an "isolated incident". Separately, multiple gunshots were fired into a crowd of mourners attending a graveside funeral in Wisconsin, wounding two people. No arrests have been made in connection to Wisconsin's shooting.

267.title: Even if Virat Kohli scores a 50, people say he has failed: Azharuddin
267.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said people say Virat Kohli has failed to perform even if he scores a half-century. "There is nothing wrong with his technique. Sometimes you also need a little bit of luck," added Azharuddin. "If he gets one big score...the aggression and...confidence will come back," stated Azharuddin. Kohli scored 341 runs in IPL 2022 for RCB.

268.title: No improvement in Kashmir despite abrogation of Article 370: Sanjay Raut
268.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the recent killing of a bank manager, identified as Vijay Kumar, by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam. "You (BJP) talked about the return of Kashmiri Pandits and fetched votes in the name of Hindutva. There is no improvement in people's lives despite the abrogation of Article 370," Raut said.

269.title: Heroin worth ₹20 lakh seized in Assam; 2 arrested
269.article_body: Two drug peddlers were arrested after heroin worth ₹20 lakh was reportedly seized in the Kaliganj area of Assam, the officials said on Friday. "We have apprehended two persons named Nur Hussain and Monirul Islam and we recovered four soap cases containing 43 grams of suspected heroin," the Additional Superintendent of Police, Partha Pratim Das said.

270.title: Chinese banks agreed to refinance $2.3 bn in debt to Pak: Minister
270.article_body: Chinese banks have agreed to provide 15 billion renminbi (about $2.3 billion) in refinancing to Pakistan, Pakistani Finance Minister Miftah Ismail said. "Inflow is expected shortly after some routine approvals...This will help shore up our foreign exchange reserves," he added. Notably, Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves have declined to just over $9.7 billion, according to official data.

271.title: Brad Pitt-starrer 'Bullet Train' to release in India on August 5
271.article_body: Actor Brad Pitt's upcoming film 'Bullet Train' will release in theatres in India on August 5. In a statement on Wednesday, Sony Pictures India announced that the action comedy film will be released in four languages including English, Hindi, Tamil and Telugu. Directed by David Leitch, 'Bullet Train' is based on the Japanese novel 'Maria Beetle' by Kotaro Isaka.

272.title: Kenyan man who attacked 8 in Mumbai has mental health issues: Police
272.article_body: The 50-year-old Kenyan national who attacked eight pedestrians with a knife near Bombay High Court on Wednesday has mental health issues, police said on Friday. During interrogation, the accused changed his versions and also spoke about God, a police official said. While he was arrested on the same day, the injured people were admitted to a hospital, he added.

273.title: India gets Asia's largest Liquid Mirror Telescope, pic released
273.article_body: India has set up its first Liquid Mirror Telescope (LMT) in Uttarakhand to observe supernovae, space debris, asteroids and other celestial objects, the government said. The telescope is Asia's largest and has been built by astronomers from India, Belgium and Canada. It is located at an altitude of 2,450 metres at the Devasthal Observatory in Nainital.

274.title: Remove fliers from planes if they violate COVID-19 norms: Delhi HC
274.article_body: The Delhi High Court has called for strict action against those found violating mask and hand hygiene protocols at airports and in aircraft, while observing that the COVID-19 pandemic hasn't abated. "Violators should be removed physically, if need be," it added. The bench also observed that violators should be booked, fined and placed on the no-fly list to ensure compliance.

275.title: Hemsworth's 'Thor: Love and Thunder' to release in India a day before US
275.article_body: Marvel India on Friday announced that 'Thor: Love and Thunder' will release in India on July 7, one day before the US market. The Taika Waititi directorial stars Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Karen Gillan, Chris Pratt and Russell Crowe among others in pivotal roles. 'Thor: Love and Thunder' will feature Christian Bale as the supervillain, Gorr the God Butcher.

276.title: Chhattisgarh CM requests PM to refund ₹17,240 cr collected under NPS
276.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has requested PM Narendra Modi to direct the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) to refund ₹17,240 crore deposited towards the National Pension System (NPS) since November 2004. This comes after PFRDA rejected the state government's request to withdraw the money. Baghel said that his government has decided to reinstate the old pension scheme.

277.title: Pak’s bowling attack is world's best, English players praise us: Rizwan
277.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan said Pakistan's bowling attack is the best in the world. "It feels really great when...some English players praise our bowlers," added Rizwan. Talking about Pakistan captain Babar Azam, Rizwan cited the example of him threatening to walk out of a Pepsi advertisement when asked to consume the beverage during Ramadan, as an indication of his greatness.

278.title: What Bhangra is for Punjabis, films are for Telugu audience: Adivi
278.article_body: Speaking about why the pandemic didn't impact Telugu film industry, actor-filmmaker Adivi Sesh said, "What Bhangra is for Punjabis, films are for the Telugu audience." He further said the industry had a "bonanza of films" doing well between the first and second COVID-19 waves. "The confidence of taking Telugu cinema into Hindi and the world comes from...support of...audience," Adivi added.

279.title: Over 30,000 Russian soldiers killed: Ukraine as war enters 100th day
279.article_body: Ukraine on Friday claimed that it has killed around 30,950 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said that its forces have destroyed 1,367 Russian tanks and over 380 aircraft, including 175 helicopters. The ministry added that 3,366 armoured personnel carriers, 675 artillery systems and 207 multiple launch rocket systems have also been destroyed.

280.title: Sony to help satellites in orbit communicate via space lasers
280.article_body: Sony has formed a new unit, Sony Space Communications, that will build and supply devices to help small satellites in orbit to communicate with one another via laser beams. The devices will work between satellites in space and satellites communicating with ground stations. Sony did not specify when it expects to have its first commercial device operating in space.

281.title: SC bans mining, factories within 1 km of national parks, sanctuaries
281.article_body: There can be no mining and factories in a one-kilometre buffer zone around wildlife sanctuaries and national parks, Supreme Court said. If existing Eco-Sensitive Zone goes beyond buffer zone or if any statutory instrument prescribes a higher limit, then such extension shall prevail, SC added. Manufacturing and similar activities underway along these zones will go on only with official permission.

282.title: SC dismisses plea over illegal excavation, construction at Puri temple
282.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday dismissed a plea alleging illegal excavation and construction work by the Odisha government at the Shree Jagannath Temple in Puri. The construction activity being undertaken is necessary for the larger public interest, it added. The court said that a PIL other than being in the public interest is detrimental to the public interest, SC stated.

283.title: Up to 40 people trapped as fire breaks out in 10-storey building in Russia, pics surface
283.article_body: As many as 40 people are feared to be trapped after a huge fire broke out in a 10-storey office building in Moscow. Several people have been seen on the roof of the Grand Setun Plaza building in Kuntsevo district, nine miles from the Kremlin. A team of around 200 firefighters is at the scene attempting to save lives.

284.title: Struggle is 'glamourised unnecessarily' in industry: Panchayat's Pankaj Jha
284.article_body: 'Panchayat' actor Pankaj Jha said actors should learn from their struggling days and not dramatise it into a "sob story". "One should even enjoy the struggle," Jha added. He further stated that poverty and struggle are "glamourised unnecessarily" in the industry which is "rubbish". "What is wrong [with] doing the job of a peon?" the actor further asked.

285.title: Amitabh shares throwback pic from wedding on 49th anniversary
285.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to Instagram on Friday to share a throwback picture with Jaya Bachchan from their wedding on the occasion of their 49th wedding anniversary. "I fold my hands and thank all those who have showered love to Jaya and me on our marriage anniversary. Thank you," he wrote. Several people congratulated Amitabh and Jaya in the comments section.

286.title: KK was a real artiste, he never cared about networking: Farah Khan
286.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan condoled singer KK's demise saying he was a real artiste who only cared about singing. She added, "He wasn't networking [or] trying to get...second song from you. He would come quietly and do his job." Farah further said that the last time she met him, he told her, "Make a film quickly so that I can sing."

287.title: Shah Rukh Khan's look with bandaged face from new film 'Jawan' goes viral
287.article_body: The teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'Jawan' was released on Friday, showing the actor's new look for the film, directed by Atlee. Shah Rukh's face can be seen wrapped in bandages in the teaser. The film is set to release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada on June 2, 2023.

288.title: 1,800 pilgrims from Telangana to travel to Mecca as Haj resumes
288.article_body: As many as 1,800 Hajis from Telangana will travel to Mecca as the Haj pilgrimage resumes in July 2022. "We, along with the government of Telangana, have visited the airport twice to see...no problems are being faced," said Haj Committee Chairman Mohammed Saleem. "If any traveller has COVID-19, he'll have to be dropped from the list," he added.

289.title: We're investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh: Billionaire Gautam Adani
289.article_body: Billionaire industrialist Gautam Adani on Friday said that the Adani Group is investing ₹70,000 crore in Uttar Pradesh. Adani further said that ₹24,000 crore will be invested in developing UP's road and transport infrastructure while another ₹35,000 crore will be invested in the state's multimodal logistics and defence sectors. "We anticipate this investment creating over 30,000 jobs," said Adani.

290.title: Man can't save dharma: Prakash on 'Aashram 3 defames Hinduism' claim
290.article_body: Director Prakash Jha reacted to claims of web series 'Aashram 3' defaming Hinduism, saying, "Admi dharma ko nahi bacha sakta, dharma admi ko bachata hai (Man can't save dharma, dharma saves man)." He further said that the show is a work of fiction, adding that whatever is true is religion and if something is untrue then it can't be religion.

291.title: 2 kids drown while bathing in a pond in UP's Jhansi
291.article_body: Two kids, aged nine and 11, drowned in a pond while bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi district. The bodies of the deceased were recovered with the help of divers on Thursday evening, SHO of Gursarai police station Arun Kumar Tiwari said. Notably, they were declared dead by the doctors at the community health centre, Gursarai.

292.title: 85% complaints on BESCOM WhatsApp helpline resolved: Officials
292.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has resolved 628 of the 736 complaints it had received within a week, which is about 85%, through its WhatsApp helpline numbers, according to officials. The consumers have been sending pictures and videos of the power-related issues, which helps officers resolve the problem on a priority basis, a BESCOM official said.

293.title: Investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore signed in Uttar Pradesh: PM Modi
293.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday, addressing Uttar Pradesh Investors Summit, said investment deals worth ₹80,000 crore have been signed across sectors in the state, which will help create thousands of employment opportunities. "I congratulate the youth of UP...as they'll benefit most from this," he added. "This is the time to set new goals for next 25 years," the PM said.

294.title: Kartik not running after money: 'Bhool...' producer on fee hike report
294.article_body: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' producer Bhushan Kumar said in an interview that Kartik Aaryan "isn't running after money". This comes after a report claimed that Kartik has hiked his fee after Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2's success. Bhushan, who has collaborated with Kartik for another film, said the film went through a difficult phase in terms of finances, but Kartik stood by them.

295.title: Cristiano? They often ask why he is a starter: Portugal coach Santos
295.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo, Portugal football team's coach Fernando Santos said, "Cristiano Ronaldo? They often ask why he is a starter. It's the million-dollar question." Santos did not include Cristiano as a part of the starting XI for Portugal's UEFA Nations League match against Spain which ended 1-1. He termed this decision as a "technical" and "tactical" move.

296.title: I'd like to play there: Bavuma on competing in IPL in future
296.article_body: South Africa limited-overs captain Temba Bavuma has expressed his desire to play in the IPL, saying, "The stronger my performances, the more realistic the opportunity becomes." He added, "I've also developed this fantasy of captaining a team." The 32-year-old was not one of the 33 South African players who entered the IPL 2022 mega auction in February.

297.title: Tesla calling staff for 40 hrs/week is like the 1950s: Aus billionaire
297.article_body: Australian billionaire Scott Farquhar commented on Tesla's return to office directive saying it feels "like something out of the 1950s". As per the directive, employees at Tesla are required to spend a minimum of 40 hours in the office per week. Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to Farquhar's tweets saying they "illustrate why recessions serve a vital economic cleansing function".

298.title: Hardik Pandya is a 4D player now: Kiran More after GT's IPL win
298.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More has said that Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya is "a four-dimensional player now". "Earlier he was a three-dimensional player...but now he is captain as well," More said. "He used to keep running behind the nets and catching the ball (at More's cricket academy)...that's when I saw the hunger in his eyes," he added.

299.title: Russia, China not interested in working with us on N Korea: US
299.article_body: China and Russia are clearly not interested in working with the US to manage North Korea's nuclear and missile arsenal, US' nuclear envoy Sung Kim said on Friday. His comments came after Russia and China last month vetoed a UN resolution sponsored by the US to impose more sanctions on North Korea over its renewed ballistic missile launches.

300.title: Elon wanted to be the wealthiest man even as a pre-schooler: Musk's father
300.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol Musk told AFP that even as a pre-schooler, the Tesla CEO had set his sights on becoming the wealthiest man alive. Recalling an incident when Elon announced his plans to become a millionaire, Errol said an adult told him that he would be disappointed. "Elon responded, 'Well, I think you're stupid'. That's typically Elon," said Errol.

301.title: No plans to attack Russia with US rockets: Ukraine
301.article_body: Ukraine is "waging a defensive war" and doesn't plan to use multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS) it receives from the US to attack facilities in Russia, a Ukrainian presidential advisor said. "Our partners know where their weapons are used," Mykhailo Podolyak added. Earlier, Russia had said it doesn't trust Kyiv to not use the weapons to fire into Russian territory.

302.title: 9 PMC junior engineers fined ₹10,000 each for dereliction of duty
302.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to fine nine of its junior engineers ₹10,000 each for dereliction of duty during projects carried out by contractors, officials said on Thursday. An audit by a third party, which was examined by a committee, found that the nine junior engineers hadn't followed the norms while clearing contractors' bills, according to an official.

303.title: Delhi woman says co-passenger flashed her at Jor Bagh metro station
303.article_body: A woman has claimed that she was flashed by a co-passenger at Delhi's Jor Bagh metro station. According to her, the man committed the crime on the pretext of asking her help with an address. She alleged that she ran to a nearby policeman, who refused to help and asked her to go to other officers to talk about it.

304.title: I have miles to go: Kartik on 'saving' industry with 'Bhool...'
304.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, on being told he saved the Hindi film industry with 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said he is flattered and humbled by the statement, adding he has miles to go and lots more to do. He added, "Stardom for me...has only meant love from my fans...When the love grows, I only feel more...motivated...as it is to them...I owe my success."

305.title: I haven't made easy choices: Varun Dhawan on 'Jugjugg...', 'Bhediya'
305.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, while talking about his upcoming projects 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' and 'Bhediya', said he hasn't made any "easy choices". "I'm not playing the smart alec, with a 100 one-liners and body-hugging clothes," he said while referring to his character in 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. The actor added that he has inferred a lot from his personal life for the film.

306.title: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Mukesh Ambani becomes 8th richest?
306.article_body: Elon Musk is the richest person worldwide with a net worth of $227 billion on Bloomberg's Billionaires Index. He's followed by Jeff Bezos($149 billion), Bernard Arnault ($138 billion), Bill Gates ($124 billion), Warren Buffett ($114 billion), Larry Page ($106 billion), Sergey Brin ($102 billion), Mukesh Ambani ($99.7 billion), Gautam Adani ($98.7 billion) and Steve Ballmer ($96.8 billion).

307.title: Google to merge Meet and Duo into a single video calling app
307.article_body: Google has announced that it will merge its video-calling apps Meet and Duo into a single app in the coming weeks. Duo app will be renamed to Google Meet, the company said. It'll add features to Duo such as the ability to schedule meetings, customisable virtual backgrounds in calls and meetings, and allow up to 100 participants in video calls.

308.title: Indian govt team makes 1st official visit to Afghanistan since 2021 Taliban takeover
308.article_body: An Indian delegation led by a Foreign Ministry official met the Taliban regime in Afghanistan's Kabul on Thursday. This is the first official Indian visit to Kabul since the Taliban took over Afghanistan in August 2021. As per the Ministry of External Affairs, the purpose of the visit was to discuss India's humanitarian aid to Afghanistan.

309.title: Urfi shares screenshots of abusive messages, says 'The way people want me dead is scary'
309.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT contestant Urfi Javed took to Instagram Stories to share screenshots of hate and abusive messages she received. One of the trolls said Urfi should've been dead instead of Sidhu Moosewala. "I am no where involved in anyone's death (RIP to the departed souls) but the way people want me dead is so scary," Urfi wrote.

310.title: Gippy asks music labels to not leak Moosewala's upcoming songs, threatens legal action
310.article_body: Punjabi singer and actor Gippy Grewal has requested music producers to refrain from releasing Sidhu Moosewala's upcoming tracks without the consent of the singer's father. He also said that they will take legal action against those who leak Sidhu's songs. "Please hand over all the content to his father after Sidhu's Bhog on June 8," Gippy added.

311.title: Fire breaks out in godown in UP's Ghaziabad, no casualties reported
311.article_body: A fire broke out in a godown near Shaheed Nagar Metro Station in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Friday, officials said. "More than 12 fire tenders are engaged in dousing operation. No casualties have been reported. Fire has been brought under control," Chief Fire Officer (CFO) said. "It will take some more time to douse the fire completely," the CFO added.

312.title: 24-yr-old man wanted in murder case held in east Delhi
312.article_body: A 24-year-old man wanted in a murder case was arrested by the police in the east Delhi area on Friday. The accused, identified as Prince Wadhwa, was allegedly involved in the murder of a man, identified as Jitender Chaudhary, at Krishna Nagar on May 24. Notably, Wadhwa allegedly committed the crime along with two of his associates, police said.

313.title: Watching KK perform live was a learning experience: Shilpa Rao
313.article_body: Singer Shilpa Rao, while talking about late singer KK, said bond with a fellow musician is inseparable because their music lives on forever. "I was fortunate that I had the opportunity of opening his concerts and watching him perform live was always a learning experience for me," Shilpa said. She further called KK one of the most supportive persons.

314.title: Nehra is one of the best tactical coaches in IPL: Kirsten
314.article_body: Gujarat Titans mentor Gary Kirsten has said that the franchise's coach Ashish Nehra is "tactically one of the best coaches in the IPL". "He (Nehra) coaches with his heart, always thinking about his players and how he can help them," Kirsten said. He added, "Ashish wants his players to have options and he helps them understand when to use them."

315.title: Hardik had only 1 lifeline, that was to do well in IPL 2022: Sodhi
315.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said all-rounder Hardik Pandya was far away from knocking on the doors of the Indian team before IPL 2022 and struggling in his career. "He had only one lifeline and that was to do well in IPL 2022," added Sodhi. "If a guy's life has been changed by IPL 2022, it is Hardik," stated Sodhi.

316.title: WB man prints fake notes, gets beaten up when paid with those; arrested
316.article_body: Police arrested a 59-year-old man for allegedly printing fake currency notes in West Bengal's Bankura. The accused, Gurupada Acharjee, reportedly used a ₹500 note to buy toys at a shop. When the shopkeeper realised it was fake, he was beaten up by the locals. Police have recovered fake notes of value ₹1,65,560, a printer and other materials from his home.

317.title: Prithviraj, Sanyogita also had an age difference: Manushi on age gap with Akshay
317.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, speaking about the 29-year age gap between her and 'Samrat Prithviraj' co-star Akshay Kumar, said, "Our characters (Prithviraj and Sanyogita) also had an age difference." "Irrespective of who's older than whom, it doesn't matter if...woman or man is older, cast should be appropriate," she said, adding, "You're a good actor...if you're able to look (close to your character)."

318.title: Police chief didn't know of 911 calls: Senator on Texas school shooting
318.article_body: The commander overseeing police during a shooting at an elementary school in Texas wasn't informed of panicked 911 calls coming from children trapped inside, Senator Roland Gutierrez said. "There's human error, there's system error," Gutierrez added, saying it was unclear exactly who was receiving the calls. Twenty-one people, including 19 kids, were killed in the mass shooting on May 24.

319.title: Mukesh Ambani replaces Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man
319.article_body: Reliance Industries's Mukesh Ambani has replaced Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest man. According to  Bloomberg Billionaires Index, as of June 3, the total net worth of Mukesh Ambani is $99.7 billion and the total net worth of Gautam Adani is $98.7 billion. While Ambani now stands at the eighth position worldwide, Adani is placed in the ninth place.

320.title: Maha man on ventilator dies due to power outage at home: Police
320.article_body: A 38-year-old man, who was put on ventilator support at his home in Maharashtra's Kolhapur, allegedly died after the breathing machine stopped functioning following a power outage. The patient was suffering from a lung illness for the past few years, police said. The electricity distribution company had snapped the power supply alleging non-payment of bill, police added.

321.title: Couldn't muster courage to talk to KK's wife or kids at funeral: Javed Ali
321.article_body: Singer Javed Ali expressed grief over the demise of KK, saying, "I cannot focus and concentrate on anything. I just can't forget KK." He said he "couldn't muster the courage" to speak with KK's wife and children at the funeral, which was held on Thursday in Mumbai. "I shall go to meet KK's...family after a few days," Javed further said.

322.title: Russia achieved none of its initial objectives in Ukraine: UK
322.article_body: As the war in Ukraine entered its 100th day, UK Defence Ministry said Russia has failed to achieve its initial objectives to seize Kyiv and Ukrainian centres of government because of "false planning and poor tactical execution". The ministry added that the war in Ukraine will continue for some time if the Kremlin wants to achieve any form of success.

323.title: Moosewala's body acted as shield, saved his friend from fatal injuries: AAP MLA Banawali
323.article_body: AAP MLA Gurpreet Banawali, after meeting with Sidhu Moosewala's injured friends, said Moosewala went down fighting. "After suffering multiple bullet injuries, Moosewala fell on (his friend) Gurpreet. Moosewala’s body acted as a shield and probably saved Gurpreet from fatal injuries," he said. "Moosewala fought and fired back despite being attacked from three sides," Banawali added.

324.title: Motor mechanic held for raping, impregnating 17-yr-old girl in Gurugram
324.article_body: A 21-year-old motor mechanic was arrested for allegedly raping a 17-year-old girl and impregnating her in Gurugram, police said. A complaint was lodged by the girl's mother on Wednesday alleging that a man repeatedly raped her daughter. "She told me that a man who came to our tea stall was raping her on the pretext of marriage," the mother said.

325.title: South Korea to remove quarantine for unvaccinated foreign arrivals
325.article_body: South Korean PM Han Duck-soo on Friday said the country will lift its seven-day quarantine requirement for foreign arrivals without vaccination from June 8, adding that the COVID-19 situation in South Korea has stabilised. He further said that South Korea will also start lifting aviation regulations imposed on international flights to ensure that they can operate in a timely manner.

326.title: Tesla needs to cut staff by 10%: Elon Musk as he pauses all hiring
326.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the company needs to cut staff by around 10% as he has a "super bad feeling" about the economy, according to an internal email. The email, titled "pause all hiring worldwide", was sent to Tesla executives on Thursday. Earlier, Musk asked Tesla employees to return to the office or leave the company.

327.title: Edtech startup Udayy shuts down, fires entire staff of 100-120 employees
327.article_body: Gurugram-based edtech startup Udayy has shut its operations and fired its entire workforce of 100-120 employees after business slowed due to the resumption of offline classes in schools. Udayy Co-founder Mahak Garg in a LinkedIn post said that all employees were paid a generous severance and the decision was announced in a company-wide town hall on April 4.

328.title: After parents scold him over video games, 18-year-old boy kills self in TN
328.article_body: An 18-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after getting upset over his parents scolding him for playing video games in Vellottamparappu in Tamil Nadu's Erode, police said. The deceased reportedly consumed poison when his parents went to work on Wednesday. On being informed of the matter, the parents took their son to a hospital where he was declared brought dead.

329.title: Take strict action against Kashmir killings: BSP chief Mayawati to Centre
329.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Friday urged the Centre to take strict action against the recent targeted killings in Kashmir. "Innocent people are being killed every day in Jammu and Kashmir...there's an atmosphere of panic," Mayawati tweeted. "The central government should take strict action against such guilty elements, this is the demand of BSP," she added.

330.title: African Swine Fever detected at Manipur farm; owner claims 80 pigs culled
330.article_body: African Swine Fever outbreak was confirmed at a piggery in Manipur's Kamjong on Thursday, following which Deputy Commissioner declared the 1 km radius around the farm as an "infected zone". The piggery's owner claimed that 80 pigs have been culled in the last few days. The Deputy Commissioner also declared the 10 km radius around the farm a "surveillance zone".

331.title: Had Sardar Patel not acted, India's map wouldn't be the same: Shah
331.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said India would have had a different map if Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel had not taken police action. "Entire country is indebted to Sardar Patel for liberating us from the tyrannical rule of the Nizams," Shah said at an event to celebrate Telangana Formation Day. He further accused Telangana CM KCR of not cooperating with Centre.

332.title: 2 dead, 30 hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in MP
332.article_body: Two people died and around 30 others are hospitalised after drinking contaminated water in Madhya Pradesh's Narsinghpur, the district hospital in-charge said. "A health team has been deployed," the district hospital in-charge added. A slurry of rainwater and cow dung somehow entered a pit, which had a valve of a pipeline deep in the ground, District Collector Rohit Singh said.

333.title: SBI assures financial support to family of bank manager killed in J&K
333.article_body: SBI on Thursday assured financial support to the family of the 26-year-old bank manager who was shot dead by terrorists inside Ellaquai Dehati Bank in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. EDB is a Srinagar-headquartered regional rural bank sponsored by SBI. Kumar was one of many such bankers working in Kashmir Valley ensuring uninterrupted banking services to the public, SBI added.

334.title: Moosewala also opened fire, unfortunately he had just 2 bullets left: AAP MLA Banawali
334.article_body: After meeting the two injured friends of Sidhu Moosewala, AAP MLA Banawali said the accused punctured the singer's vehicle's tyres and opened fire from three sides. "Moosewala also opened fire, but unfortunately he had just two bullets left in his weapon," he added. "According to his friends, he had exhausted them all a few days ago," Banawali said.

335.title: Rohit understands us well, comes up with Plan B if we struggle: Siraj
335.article_body: Team India pacer Mohammed Siraj said it is a great feeling to play under Team India captain Rohit Sharma who understands the players so well. "Whenever we have a tough time out there on the field, he is the one who comes up with a plan B and motivates the bowlers to do better in the game," added Siraj.

336.title: Truck driver runs over 3 drunk men in Chennai, arrested
336.article_body: A truck driver from Uttar Pradesh was arrested for allegedly running over three drunk men at a private truck yard in Chennai. Police said, the men, who were consuming alcohol in the yard, got into an argument with the driver, harassed and demanded money from him, following which he attempted to flee. He didn't intentionally run over them, police added.

337.title: Woman sexually assaulted at Delhi's Jor Bagh Metro Station
337.article_body: A woman was allegedly sexually assaulted by a fellow passenger at the Jor Bagh Metro Station in New Delhi. The woman alleged that the accused did inappropriate behaviour while asking for help with an address. In a series of tweets, the woman alleged that she didn't receive much help from the police officials at the station.

338.title: Umran made people run away by threatening them: Aakash Chopra on IPL 2022
338.article_body: Discussing SRH pacer Umran Malik's performances in IPL 2022, former India opener Aakash Chopra said, "He has made people run away by scaring and threatening them." "Whenever he has bowled well, he has taken three-four wickets and even a five-wicket haul," added Aakash. "He is the Jammu Tawi Express," stated Aakash. Umran picked 22 wickets in IPL 2022.

339.title: 2 children drown while taking bath in river in UP's Pilibhit
339.article_body: Two children drowned while taking a bath in the Sharda river in Uttar Pradesh's Pilibhit. The body of deceased, identified as Mohini (12) and her cousin Aniket (14), were recovered with the help of locals. According to the police, locals told that Mohini started drowning first while taking bath and Aniket also drowned in trying to save Mohini.

340.title: 7 feared charred to death as bus catches fire after collision with tempo in K'taka
340.article_body: As many as seven people travelling in a private bus are feared to have been charred to death in an accident near Kamalapura in Karnataka's Kalaburagi on Friday, police said. The accident took place when the bus, carrying 29 passengers from Goa to Hyderabad, and a tempo collided, police added. The other 22 passengers managed to escape from the bus.

341.title: Ahmedabad man held for circulating child pornography on social media
341.article_body: Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell on Thursday arrested Deepak Shankhalpara, a resident of Jashoda Nagar, for allegedly storing and circulating child pornography material on social media. "Upon checking...cellphone of the accused, we've found 13 videos of child porn," a police officer said. "Apart from this, the accused had also shared child pornography material on Facebook Messenger," the officer added.

342.title: Canada accuses China of harassing its aircraft near North Korea
342.article_body: The Canadian military has accused Chinese warplanes of harassing its patrol aircraft during UN sanctions patrols along the border with North Korea to monitor evasions. Canadian Armed Forces said on several occasions its aircrews have had to alter their path to "avoid a potential collision with the intercepting aircraft". The incidents occurred between April 26 and May 26, it added.

343.title: Actor Adivi Sesh gets honorary medal from Black Cat Commandos for 'Major'
343.article_body: Adivi Sesh's 'Major' was recently screened for National Security Guard (NSG) in Mumbai, where 312 commandos watched the movie with their families. The actor received an honorary medal from the Black Cat Commandos for his performance in the film. 'Major' is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

344.title: Samrat Prithviraj is a very important film in my career: Akshay Kumar
344.article_body: Akshay Kumar has called his film 'Samrat Prithviraj' a rare project, adding that it's a very important film in his career. "It's my legacy project because I'm getting to honour...legendary Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan," he added. Akshay further said he hopes this film inspires many to lead their life with strong values and "get the courage to stand up against...every evil".

345.title: 17-yr-old girl returning home after party gang-raped in Hyderabad
345.article_body: A 17-year-old girl returning home after attending a get-together at a pub was gang-raped in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills area. According to police, some of the youngsters who'd met the victim at the party approached her, offering to drop her home. "When...car stopped at an isolated location in...darkness, the youngsters violated her one after the other," a police officer said.

346.title: Instagram expands Reels to 90 seconds, allows users to add own audio
346.article_body: Meta on Thursday announced a series of updates and new features for its Reels on Facebook and Instagram. While Instagram Reels' length has been extended to 90 seconds from 60 seconds, users can now also import their own audio directly. Instagram Reels will now also have the option of adding stickers, poll, quiz and emoji slider stickers.

347.title: Scoring 50s, 60s won't help Vihari; important to get tons: Azharuddin
347.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said India batter Hanuma Vihari can play for the national team for a long time, only if he scores big runs consistently. "It's very important for him to get the big scores. He has to score hundreds to grab the chance," added Azharuddin. "Scoring only 50s and 60s is not...going to help him," stated Azharuddin.

348.title: Russia shipped 1 lakh tonnes of stolen wheat to Syria: Ukraine
348.article_body: Russia has sent its ally Syria an estimated 1,00,000 tonnes of wheat stolen from Ukraine since invading the country on February 24, the Ukrainian embassy in Beirut said in a statement to Reuters. "This is criminal activity," it added. The embassy alleged that the wheat was "stolen from a facility that combines wheat from three Ukrainian regions into one batch".

349.title: Women climb down 30-ft well to get water in MP; videos surface
