349.article_body: Videos of women climbing up a 30-foot-deep well in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Dindori after going down to get drinking water has surfaced online. "Be it day or night, we've to go down the well and fetch water...politicians come but nobody solves our problem," a villager told The Quint. "We'll not cast...votes now until we get...water," another villager claimed.

350.title: Pushkar Singh Dhami wins Champawat bypolls, to remain Uttarakhand CM
350.article_body: BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami on Friday won the Champawat bypolls by over 55,000 votes and he will now continue to remain the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand. He defeated Congress' Nirmala Gahotri, SP candidate Manoj Kumar and independent candidate Himanshu Garkoti. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Dhami and said, "I'm confident he will work even harder for the progress of Uttarakhand."

351.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' banned in Kuwait, Oman: Reports
351.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj', which released in India today, has been banned in Kuwait and Oman, as per reports. In a tweet shared by trade analyst Girish Johar, it was mentioned that the governments of the two countries have banned the film on the warrior king. Meanwhile, Qatar has reportedly put the release of the film on hold.

352.title: Gold price rises slightly today, silver selling at ₹62,700 per kg
352.article_body: Both gold and silver futures have climbed in the domestic market on June 3 after trading on the lower side for three days in a row. On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), gold futures stand at ₹51,340/10 grams. The previous close was recorded at ₹51,269. Meanwhile, silver is selling at ₹62,700 per kg.

353.title: CM Mann should apologise to Moosewala’s parents: Warring
353.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann must own moral responsibility for Sidhu Moosewala's death and apologise to his parents. The state government's decision to restore security of those protectees whose security it had withdrawn earlier hints at its negligence and grave lapse, he alleged. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

354.title: Coinbase extends hiring freeze, revokes some accepted job offers
354.article_body: Coinbase has extended its hiring freeze for "as long as the macro-economic factors remain in place". They also revoked accepted offers from some candidates who haven't joined it yet. "We always knew cryptocurrency would be volatile, but that volatility alongside larger economic factors may test the company, and us personally, in new ways," said LJ Brock, Coinbase's Chief People Officer.

355.title: Slandering of people in higher positions on rise: CJI NV Ramana
355.article_body: Chief Justice of India Justice NV Ramana on Thursday said that slandering of people who are in higher positions has been on the rise in recent times. "Those who could not achieve their selfish goals through the system are giving misinterpretation to courts' judgements through which the number of people who get sadistic pleasure is also increasing," Ramana added.

356.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru rise by 75% in a day to 276
356.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by nearly 75% in a day to 276, according to BBMP data for Thursday. The city had reported 158 daily cases on Wednesday. The total active clusters in the city also rose to six in the same period, while the deaths due to the virus remained zero on both days.

357.title: After Sonia Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19
357.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Friday tweeted that she has tested positive for COVID-19. This comes a day after party chief Sonia Gandhi contracted the infection. Adding that she has mild symptoms, Priyanka wrote, "Following all the protocols, I have quarantined myself at home. I would request those who came in contact with me to take all necessary precautions.”

358.title: Apple to improve working hours for retail staff in the US: Report
358.article_body: Apple has agreed to improve the working conditions of its retail staff in the US and make their work schedules flexible, amid employees' push towards unionisation, media reports said. The changes will include extending the minimum time period between shifts to 12 hours from 10 hours. Employees won't be scheduled to work more than five days in a row.

359.title: 3 Indian Navy personnel held for assaulting shop owner, 2 others in Mumbai
359.article_body: Three Indian Navy personnel were arrested on Thursday for allegedly ransacking a pan shop and assaulting three persons, including the shop owner, in south Mumbai. The incident occurred on Wednesday night when the accused were consuming alcohol near a residential area, police said. They were angered after residents requested them to stop drinking which led to an altercation, police added.

360.title: SRK's film with Atlee titled 'Jawan', actor to play double role: Report
360.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie with filmmaker Atlee is reportedly titled 'Jawan'. "The announcement will be made soon by releasing a teaser which is about 1 min 34 seconds long," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. The film will reportedly feature Shah Rukh in a double role. Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra are also part of the film.

361.title: Beating Federer with full stadium backing him my best match ever: Cilic
361.article_body: Former US Open champion Marin Cilic said he considers defeating Roger Federer in the semi-finals of the US Open in 2014, as the best match he has ever played. "The crowd that I was faced against...they were cheering obviously for [Federer], full stadium," added Cilic. Cilic defeated Federer 6-3, 6-4, 6-4, going on to win his maiden Grand Slam title.

362.title: Tesla may have Optimus prototype working for AI Day on Sept 30: Musk
362.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm's AI Day has now been pushed to September 30. "Tesla AI Day pushed to September 30, as we may have an Optimus prototype working by then," he wrote on Twitter. Earlier, Musk had confirmed that Tesla would show a sneak preview of its humanoid Tesla Bot on its now-delayed AI Day.

363.title: 22-yr-old man held for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow in Pune
363.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a cow in Pune's Lonavala. The accused was reportedly found in an objectionable position with the cow by one of his neighbours, following which the animal's owner filed a complaint. A case has been filed against the accused under Section 377 of the Indian Penal Code.

364.title: I saw Dr Strange, I was like I want to be part of Marvel universe: Kartik
364.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, on being asked if he has seen a trailer in recent times that made him want to be a part of it, said, "Recently, I saw Dr Strange in...theatre, I was like...I want to be...part of...Marvel universe." "They...know how to create magic," he added. 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is the highest-grossing film of the year.

365.title: Man, link between LeT & Pune terror operative Junaid, arrested in J&K
365.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad arrested 28-year-old carpenter, Aftab Hussain Shah, from Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar in connection to case in which Mohammed Junaid was arrested from Pune last month. Shah is believed to be the link between Junaid and a Lashkar-e-Taiba operative based in a foreign country, an officer said. He'll be produced before a local court in Pune on Friday.

366.title: For 1st time in 3 decades, Noida RTO generates highest revenue in state
366.article_body: Since its formation in 1993, the Noida RTO for the first time has generated the highest revenue among all 75 districts of Uttar Pradesh. The Noida RTO earned ₹496 crore in 2021-22. It achieved 89.7% of its revenue target followed by Mirzapur (79.5%) and Lucknow (79.51%). Notably, Noida RTO comes under the Meerut zone which comprises six districts.

367.title: Which words were Spelling Bee's 14-year-old Indian-origin winner Harini asked to spell?
367.article_body: Harini Logan, 14-year-old Indian-origin girl from US' Texas, who won the 2022 Scripps National Spelling Bee, was asked to spell the words tyrolienne, tauromachian, ditalini, charadriiform, sereh, drimys and Powys. Among the 22 words she spelled correctly in the spell-off were spealbone, phreatophyte, gaydiang, parison, glochis, saccharose, chorepiscopus, ornithorhynchus, nandubay and malbrouck.

368.title: Everyone eats same food, uses same restrooms: Musk on Tesla's work culture
368.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while responding to a Twitter user regarding Tesla's work environment, said, "Everyone eats the same food, uses the same restrooms, etc- no executive chef or other ivory tower stuff. There shouldn't be this workers vs management two-class system. Everyone is a worker." The Twitter user had remarked that there is "no blue/white distinction" at Tesla.

369.title: Citizenship Amendment Act will not be implemented in Kerala: CM Vijayan
369.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Thursday said that his government would not implement the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) in the state. "The government has a clear position on CAA. That will continue," he added. "No one here has the authority to determine citizenship on the basis of religion," Vijayan stated. "Nowadays, attempts are being made to destroy secularism," he added.

370.title: Indian-origin teen Harini Logan wins Spelling Bee 2022; spells 22 words in 90 secs
370.article_body: Harini Logan, 14, an Indian-origin teenager living in San Antonio, Texas, has won the Scripps National Spelling Bee 2022. In a first-of-its-kind spell-off round, Logan spelt 22 words in 90 seconds beating 12-year-old Indian-origin Vikram Raju. Logan's final winning word was 'moorhen', a kind of a water bird. She received a trophy and a cash prize of $50,000.

371.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann meets Sidhu Moosewala's family amid protests by locals
371.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann today met the family of late singer-politician Sidhu Moosewala in Moosa village in Punjab's Mansa district. Mann visited the Moosewala family, four days after the singer-politician was shot dead. Heavy security was deployed near Moosewala's residence and across the village as several locals held protests against the AAP government.

372.title: Testament of faith: Zelenskyy as 50 embassies resume operations in Kyiv
372.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said 50 embassies have resumed operations in Kyiv amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. "Every new embassy that returns to our capital is a testament to our faith in our victory," he added. Earlier, India announced that its embassy in Ukraine, which was temporarily operating out of Poland, would resume its operation in Kyiv from May 17.

373.title: 6 college students suspended for wearing hijab in Karnataka
373.article_body: Six students from Karnataka's Government First Grade College, Uppinangady were suspended on Thursday for wearing hijab, according to the institute's authorities. The students, who were suspended for two days, will be provided remedial classes, a college teacher said. The decision was taken to "contain violence and to prevent the issue from escalating," college authorities said.

374.title: UN approves change of Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye'
374.article_body: The UN has changed Turkey's official name to 'Türkiye', following a request from Ankara for it. The rebranding is done in order to dissociate it from the bird of the same name and the negative connotations associated with it. "Türkiye is the best representation and expression of the Turkish people's culture, civilisation, and values," said the Turkish President last year.

375.title: Replicating Cristiano's style of play is 'impossible': Karim Benzema
375.article_body: Real Madrid's Karim Benzema said replicating Cristiano Ronaldo's style of play is impossible, adding that he "dissected" everything from Cristiano. "I tried to concentrate on his movements, dribbling, passing, ball handling," stated Benzema. Cristiano previously played for Real Madrid scoring 451 goals in 438 matches. He also became Real Madrid's all-time record goalscorer.

376.title: Congress misusing power to win Rajya Sabha polls: Vasundhara Raje
376.article_body: BJP leader and former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Thursday accused the Congress government of misusing power to win elections for four Rajya Sabha seats in the state. Her comments came after Congress MLAs were lodged in hotels amid fears of poaching. "A police vehicle has been placed behind every MLA. This is a complete abuse of power," Raje added.

377.title: WB Class 10 board exams results declared; Arnab Ghorai, Raunak Mondal emerge toppers
377.article_body: West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE) on Friday declared the results of the Madhyamik Class 10 exams. WBBSE announced Arnab Ghorai and Raunak Mondal as two toppers for this year with 693 marks. The overall pass percentage this year is 86.60%. Purba Medinipur district has the highest pass percentage at 97.63%, followed by Kalimpong at 94.71%.

378.title: 4,041 new COVID-19 cases, 10 deaths recorded in India in last 24 hours
378.article_body: India recorded 4,041 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths related to the virus in the last 24 hours. Further, India reported 2,363 COVID-19 recoveries, taking the total recoveries to 4,26,22,757. Meanwhile, the total death toll has risen to 5,24,651. Active COVID-19 cases in the country stand at 21,177.

379.title: If SRK wants to be in Ms Marvel, we'll go film again: Co-executive producer
379.article_body: Sana Amanat, co-executive producer for Marvel Studios' series 'Ms Marvel', said in an interview that the team will "film again" if Shah Rukh Khan wants to be in the show. "Shah Rukh, if you want to work with us, we're down for it," she added. In addition to Iman Vellani, the upcoming series will also feature Farhan Akhtar.

380.title: Gold worth over ₹1 crore seized at Hyderabad airport, 2 arrested
380.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad airport arrested a passenger for smuggling gold worth ₹1.65 crore on Thursday. The authorities also apprehended an employee working at the airport's COVID-19 testing centre after finding packets containing gold in the centre's dustbin. According to officials, the passenger had handed over the packets to the employee during sample collection for COVID-19 test.

381.title: UK's Queen Elizabeth to miss Friday's jubilee event amid 'discomfort'
381.article_body: Britain's Queen Elizabeth will miss a National Service of Thanksgiving on Friday after experiencing "some discomfort" during Thursday's Platinum Jubilee celebrations, Buckingham Palace said. The Platinum Jubilee celebrations mark 70 years since the Queen's coronation. On Thursday, the 96-year-old monarch had waved at crowds from the palace balcony as she watched the four-day jubilee events begin.

382.title: Import of Russian crude oil is not an India-related issue at all: MEA
382.article_body: MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday spoke about India's approach to Russian oil imports. "We've consistently maintained that our approach is guided by our energy security requirements...Many regions and countries have taken policy decisions recently with a similar perspective...This is not an India-related issue at all." He was answering a query on the increase in Russian oil imports.

383.title: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar tests COVID-19 positive
383.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar has tested positive for COVID-19. "I have tested positive for COVID-19, after being uninfected through three waves of the pandemic," he tweeted on Thursday. "I have moderate symptoms and will home-isolate myself and follow all protocols. Grateful that I am fully vaccinated," Sudhakar added. Notably, Karnataka on Thursday reported 297 new COVID-19 cases.

384.title: Hardik is bowling 4 overs but for how long we don't know: Azharuddin
384.article_body: Talking about India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, former India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "He is bowling his four overs...[but for how] long he will bowl we really don't know." "We definitely want him to bowl since he is an all-rounder," added Azharuddin. Hardik picked eight wickets for GT in the recently concluded IPL 2022 and had an economy rate of 7.27.

385.title: JNU student accuses seniors of ragging, administration begins probe
385.article_body: Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) said it has initiated an investigation after a first-year undergraduate student accused two seniors of ragging. One of the accused used to force her to do chores like washing her clothes, utensils, etc, she claimed. "My life on campus has become...intolerable due to...acts of these people," she alleged in a letter to the administration.

386.title: Kuwait summons top US diplomat over tweets 'supporting homosexuality'
386.article_body: Kuwait Foreign Ministry on Thursday summoned the US Embassy's acting Charge d'Affaires over tweets from the American embassy "supporting homosexuality". The embassy had posted a rainbow flag and a message of solidarity from US President Joe Biden for Pride month in both English and Arabic. Kuwait has asked the US embassy to respect Kuwaiti laws and "not publish such tweets".

387.title: Speeding truck hits tractor-trolley in Punjab; 3 dead, 12 injured
387.article_body: Three people were killed and 12 others were injured after a speeding truck collided with their tractor-trolley near Punjab's Tarn Taran on Thursday. A person filed a complaint claiming that the tractor-trolley had overturned on being hit by the truck, following which the latter vehicle's driver had escaped from the scene. The deceased are aged between 20 and 30.

388.title: Elon is a very caring person, he wants to save humanity: Musk's father
388.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview spoke about the former's upbringing and their relationship. Errol said, "Elon is a very caring person. He really means it when he says that he wants to save humanity. This is not a slogan or some sort of pitch." Musk and Errol are reportedly estranged and last met six years ago.

389.title: Fake call centre that cheated man of ₹1.62 cr busted in Noida, 16 held
389.article_body: Noida Police arrested 16 persons for running a fake call centre in Ghaziabad for two years. The accused had allegedly cheated a 61-year-old retired general manager of a public sector undertaking of ₹1.62 crore, among others. The accused cheated people by assuring them they could help recover the money of policies they had only paid one instalment for, police said.

390.title: 3 booked for pelting stones, assaulting 2 men in Gurugram
390.article_body: Three unidentified suspects were booked for assaulting two men, identified as Chirag Singh (31) and Chandrakant Singh (35), in Sector 16, Gurugram. The accused allegedly pelted stones at the duo's car and assaulted them, leading to Chandrakant's jaw getting broken. Notably, the accused "either had plans to rob the victims or fight with them in an inebriated state", police said.

391.title: 10 robots deployed to help people at B'luru airport on pilot basis
391.article_body: Airport authorities have deployed 10 robots, called 'Temi', at Terminal-I of Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru on a pilot basis in a bid to help passengers. "Temi, also called Sky, will not only answer passengers' queries but also help them locate various spots at...airport," an official said. The robots will be mapped to a particular floor, airport authorities said.

392.title: Pune police arrest man over threat to Maha Women Commission head
392.article_body: Pune's Sinhagad police have arrested a man for allegedly making a death threat and abusive phone call to Maharashtra State Commission for Women Chairperson Rupali Chakankar. The accused claimed in a video, while under custody, that his rivals were controlling him through satellite. A police officer said that the accused was remanded to magisterial custody for 15 days.

393.title: I learned a lot from Pujara, rate him very highly: Muhammad Rizwan
393.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan said cricketers from India and Pakistan wish to play against each other. "[However]...state-level affairs are not in the control of players," added Rizwan. Talking about Team India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, Rizwan stated that he learned a lot from Pujara when they played together for county cricket club Sussex. "I rate [him] very highly," he said.

394.title: Deadline to set up Marathi signboards extended to June 30 in Mumbai
394.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has extended the deadline for setting up Marathi signboards at all shops in Mumbai to June 30. "We'll carry out...ground-level survey between July 1 and 15 to identify if any shops...have failed to comply with the rules," Municipal Commissioner IS Chahal said. The BMC had earlier set a deadline of May 31 for the same.

395.title: Amber Heard 'absolutely not' able to pay over $10 million to Johnny Depp: Actress' lawyer
395.article_body: On being asked if Amber Heard is able to pay Johnny Depp over $10 million in damages after losing the defamation trial, Amber's lawyer Elaine Charlson Bredehoft said, "Oh no...absolutely not." "She was demonised here. A number of things were allowed in this court that shouldn't have been allowed...and it caused jury to be confused," Elaine said about the judgement.

396.title: Making the squad one thing, entering the playing XI another: Bond on Arjun Tendulkar
396.article_body: Talking about Arjun Tendulkar not being selected in MI's playing XI in last two seasons, MI bowling coach Shane Bond said, "He's got some work to go." He added, "When you're playing for a team like Mumbai...making the squad is one thing, but entering the playing XI is another." "Arjun needs to work on his batting and fielding," Bond stated.

397.title: Noida Authority demolishes 62 farmhouses along Yamuna floodplains
397.article_body: Noida Authority on Wednesday demolished 62 farmhouses along the Yamuna floodplains as part of the anti-encroachment drive, officials said. As many as 55 farmhouses situated at Tilwada and seven at Gulavali were demolished, officials added. "As per the rules, permanent structures cannot be maintained on floodplains, and any construction is liable to be dismantled," a Noida Authority official said.

398.title: Instagram launches AMBER alerts in 25 countries to help find missing children
398.article_body: Instagram has launched AMBER alerts to help locate missing children. The feature will be rolled out in 25 countries such as Australia, Ukraine, the UK and the US. It said the authorities can turn on the AMBER alert in a designated area and users will receive information like the child's photo, location of abduction and other details on their feed.

399.title: 8 workers injured after blast at chemical factory in Gujarat's Vadodara
399.article_body: At least eight workers were injured following a blast at a chemical factory at Nandesari Gujarat Industrial Development Corporation (GIDC) in Vadodara on Thursday evening. The condition of three injured workers is said to be critical. The fire that broke out following the blast could be seen from the highway, around 10 kilometres away, officials said.

400.title: Amber Heard to appeal against Johnny Depp's defamation trial verdict: Report
400.article_body: Actress Amber Heard is reported to be planning an appeal after losing a defamation trial against her former husband Johnny Depp over allegations of domestic abuse. The court ruled in favour of Depp's claim of defamation on three counts and awarded Depp $15 million in damages. Heard succeeded on only one count and was awarded $2 million.
